review: Was a wonderful experience  Enjoyed every bit of it  Staff are very friendly & accommodating  Superb neatness and cannot  Chef Sylvester was too good and made a special cake for us on order Look for Martin for any assistance within campus - always willing  Great stay !!
title: Fantastic

review: We stayed in  the Delux tents which where delightful. The staff where very professional and even treated us to a tree planting on our departure. A very interesting and hidden surprise was the agriculturalist, Eric Nzeiya, running an experimental 'Shamba' for organic farming research.
title: Very nice experience

review: Sarova Mara is in a breath taking environment with super fresh air. They offer excellent services, clean tents, good food and the staff are so hospitable. We were given an opportunity to plant a tree which was so fulfilling being a lover of environment.
title: Exciting experience

review: We stayed in Sarova Mara Game Camp in November 2020 and i have to say it was amazing experience. Great food, helpful staff, comfortable and charming tents (we stayed in the superior/bigger tent) and most of all safe in terms of Covid (what may be important for many) i.e. all measurements met like checking temperature, disinfection, wearing masks etc.  Really big thanks to you Guys for making our stay special and beautiful!
title: Great Hotel, Amazing Staff, tasty food, super comfortable & spacious tent - Strongly Recommend!

review: Ive had an amazing stay overall, from great food, friendly staff and good rooms. My highlight was the Tulia Spa massage with Anna- Best massage I've ever Had with swedish, hot stone therapy. Thank you again for the wonderful stay.
title: Review

review: Buffet dinner was  more than excellent..spoilt  forchoices. and so does the packed lunch we have for our safari. Its has many tents like hundreds so some could be far from the reception area... But it is good to walk after all the sitting in the safari. Also there are pool tables,  swimming pool and other stuff to do. they also have a great souvenir shop , the price is very reasonable compared to the ones in Nairobi. Our tent is so beautiful in the inside. We stayed only a night and we have  great luxurious experience.
title: Inside Masai Mara Park. Luxury tented  accomodation

review: Being a Tented Camp you would expect as most camps only the natural aspect of it. Sarova Mara gives you this with a modern and luxury touch.The Club tents are extremely gorgeous, interior deco details on point, huuuge beds, separate bathroom,shower and dressing space with mirrors and of course the laid back balcony with the most amazing view of nature.Family friendly, couple friendly there's just something for everyone-The food is simply amazing , international cuisine ,live cooking wide variety to choose from and to top the cookie- Great Services,very helpful and frindly staff who went out of there way to pick and drop us at our room in a golf cart which was a bit far. I would 100% recommend
title: Touch of Modern and Ethnicity all in one

review: - The Camp is really nice. - Staff are extra friendly. - Food is very good. - Stayed in tent 58, firstly they were apologizing because it was far, 1:2 minutes walking from the reception. It's view was AMAZING, seeing the greens of the park. For me the best in the Camp, better than the small lake view tents. - Woke up twice with wild animals view from the tent (buffalos and gazelles)    - They have basic and luxury tents, stayed in luxury as price difference wasn't much. - normal check out timing is 10 am
title: Amazing Camp

review: This is 'the' place to be in Masaimara Game Reserve- with its natural locale among woods, lovely cottages to live in with all modern amenities, gracious hosts and staff, delicious cuisine - one should plan a stay for 2-3 nights. Its proximity to the game area is yet another advantage. May be a beautiful escape place for the honeymooners, with no disturbance.
title: Experience of lifetime

review: Had a great time seeing all the animals in a natural state. Housekeeping was great and very sweet - shoutout to Leonard for being the best housekeeper! The food was not the best but besides that I had a great experience.
title: Great experience!

review: From the moment we arrived I knew that we would have a brilliant time here. We were welcomed with drinks and cold towels and check in was quick and easy. The tents were lovely. We had three in our tent and yes, it was a little cramped but you spend so little time there it doesn't matter. For anyone worried, the beds are fine and the bathrooms are fully plumbed in with a large shower, sink and toilet. They were kept spotlessly clean and the turndown service with hot water bottles at night is a great touch.  Meals are buffet style in a restaurant building. The food was lovely and there was everything we could have asked for. Two of the party are fussy eaters and they had no trouble with any of the food and found plenty to eat.  We had our game rides organised through the camp and
title: Amazing Safari
One of th two camps inside Masai Mara

review: The Sarova Mara Camp is located within the Masai Mara Game Sanctuary and is an absolutely top notch camp. Excellent service with lovely tent rooms, restaurants and other facilities like swimming pool, bar, spa and so on. The organic vegetable garden is good to visit. Above all the game drives are fantastic and you can see great wildlife.
title: Good place to stay

review: The check in process is quick and hassle free.  Its a large property and they have tried to keep it as natural as possible. The tents are decent size, but there are some drawbacks... there is room for only 1 person to sit inside the tent. As the bed is placed in the middle of the tent, if you are over 5feet 6inches tall, you cannot walk upright to get to the facilities. The curtain that closes the washroom area is thin and as a result there is very little privacy.  The tents are getting old and need replacing. The hotel staff is excellent and there are different events held every evening for the guests.  A Masai Mara dance, a talk on wildlife, or culture etc. The food quality is good and there is a wide variety of both vegetarian and non vegetarian food. The staff is excellent
title: Great place to stay

review: Super friendly staff, great room - ours was the club tent, I haven't seen the others! - good food, perfect pool, Café, surroundings, etc. The only things that need improvement are the shower - little water and the picnic box - they could vary a bit. After the second day we wanted something different!
title: Amazing!

review: If you are looking to stay at a high end game camp within the Mara this would be it.  The Mara itself obviously is incredible but most people want a great location among the wild life.  There is a watering hole you can see from the camp that has Zebra, Warthogs, Antelope, etc.  Once night I heard a Hyena close by and the next I heard a Lion woofing.  Don't be afraid though because you are still in a compound.    The room accommodations were great and exactly what I was hoping.  Good size tents to where you definitely feel like you're in nature but not roughing it.  Staff was friendly and there was good nightly entertainment.  You can take nature walks around the resort and see what you find.  Beautiful place.
title: A DREAM COME TRUE

review: Excellent property in the heart of the Mara which is easily accessed for game drives, lovely sun-downers and amazing bush dinners!! The lodge has specially catered for the physically challenged and have wide walking paths and a Golf cart in case one is lazy to walk after a super delicious meal.!!!  The service from the moment one gets there is simply smiles all over and very infectious ..all the staff are very courteous and this includes even the watchman who are awake throughout the night to ensure we have a peaceful sleep.  The tents are very well furnished and have all the amenities including a fast wifi.  Food is world class and wonderfully presented and they even catered for my special needs.  We shall definitely return, our special thanks to Kioko the GM and his highly
title: Amazing trip yet again! (our seventeen visit)
Luxury in midst of the jungle

review: The resort - Mara Sarova resort is just after you enter the great Masai Mara game reserve. Hence you have to pay the park fee for each 24hr your stay, if you want to avoid the park fee and pay only for the time you take game drive , stay outside the resort. This resort has a main block with bar, pool table , restaurant, organic garden, pool ( with kid's area), TT table, badminton and spa.  Then on there are cottages, there is a small lake with kayaks and paddle boats, there is also a viewing deck in front of a water hole, where animals come in the night.  The cottage The cottage is tented, we stayed in a basic cottage with double bed shared by a couple and it has an attached bathroom. The beds have mosquito nets, there is a safe to keep your valuables. There is a small patio in
title: Ideal location that compliments the game drive and hotel service.

review: Still another Jurassic Park in Kenya?  7 hour drive from Sarova Lion Hill to this place by safari, with the last two hours over rough stone dirt roads, some places with severe potholes.    Entrance of green metal gates, manned by security, with electrified fence surrounding the resort area.  Traditional greeting with hot hand wiping towels and chilled juice in glasses.  Three meals of buffet type food, to satisfy every one's different preferences.  We got tent 27, closest tent to the huge unheated pool, but right on the main pathway to the other tents further away.  Could hear conversations from guests throughout the night, along the landscaped, lighted, paved pedestrian pathways.  Tent cabin, with wooden floor, and stone bathroom, and canvas sides and top, with windows of mesh
title: Noisy, tented accomdations, no AC nor overhead fan,mosquitos a problem near water

review: For those who've had a horrible journey and a bad time at the airport customs and hassles, this camp is the best to lift your spirits. After a long and bumpy ride from Nairobi to Maasai Mara, we felt so relaxed and pampered to spend the night here.  We had a large luxury tent with a double sized bed, great bathroom facilities with hot water available at all times, a study desk, a stacked mini fridge, electric kettle, coffee and tea sachets, a picnic corner on the front porch and two couches on the inside.  Wifi is available all over the camp. Restaurant with a great view and good food. Great staff- kind and cooperative. Since we stayed only one night, we couldn't see the Maasai dance the next evening.  Electricity is shut down at night from 12 am to 4 am but which of course
title: Great week at the Sarova Mara!

review: We had the best time!  Our visit was in late June.  The weather was amazing.  A little chilly in the mornings but beautiful the rest of the day.  We flew in to the Mara via Kenya Air and met Daniel (employee of the Sarova Mara and our guide for the entire visit), who picked us up at the airstrip.  He was great!  He was extremely knowledgeable about the area and the animals.  We learned SO much from him.   Daniel dropped us off at the Sarova Mara and we were instantly met with amazing customer service.  The entire staff was so nice.  Learned our names the first day and were very kind to our children, ages 8 and 10. We honestly did not encounter a single issue with the staff.  They were all so friendly!!!!!  Our days were kept busy. Early morning game drive, breakfast, relax or
title: Great accommodation

review: Super friendly and professional staff and delicious and freshest food is how I would always remember this resort.  Martin, Nickson & Sempele are some of the names I remember of staff who were always smiling, helpful and loved to interact and engage.  There a re 2 kinds of accommodation, the standard tent and the club tent. The former is small yet comfortable, only wish there was a door to the bathroom and not just a curtain that does not cover fully. Saw the club tent and it appeared very spacious and perhaps more luxurious. all said and done one is here to be on safari and tents are only to spend the night.  The resort is spread over a large area on a hill inside the game park, surrounded and protected by electrified fencing. One may have to walk long distances to reach ones
title: Beautiful Camp Resort, awesome food and service!
Great place to stay in the Maasai Mara

review: We stayed here for just two nights but it was a good stay.  The food was good and the service was great.  The tents are a little basic depending on whether or not you paid for the club ones.  Martin took great care of us - thanks Martin!  Some things that could be improved is some walls around the tents to block noise.  We had noisy neighbors and you could hear them clearly late into the night and early in the morning.  Also some tents are a long walk and they should offer golf cart service to ferry you to the further uphill tents.  We were also able to get really close to dik diks, which is a big plus.
title: Excellent base for Mara safari

review: It's funny to write this review as I recall vividly the animals at Maasai Mara and needed a little reminder to recall this place.  I suppose this is the best type of travel combination - a great location for day activities, and the lodging that brings a smile to your face when looking back.  The tents here are not as spacious as some other parts of Kenya/Tanzania, but the goal at Maasai Mara is to not spend all the in the tent, no?  We were not bothered by the lack of a door for the bathroom (there is a curtain) - it was much less troubling than having just two outlets to charge electronic gadgets (x2).  There is a large centrally located restaurants where the food was reasonably good, with interesting entrees and desserts daily.  You get a lunch box from the lodge for all day
title: All Around Excellent Experience
Lovely hotel grounds, close to airport

review: After viewing a lot of Game Camps in Mara online, we decided to go ahead with this one. I wasn't sure how it would be and couldn't imagine the place looking at the pictures on the internet. However, we booked our stay and were excited to visit Masai Mara. The drive from Nairobi to Mara was pretty long, especially the last hour and half was extremely torturous while driving on that bumpy road. When we reached the Game Camp, we were welcomed with fresh fruit juice and the wet towels with tea tree kind of fragrance. This was highly required and refreshed us instantly. After completing the formalities at the reception, we were taken to our tent, and we found it be-au-ti-ful.. It was small, but was very well designed. The bathroom is tiny but isn't cramped up. It also has a small
title: Fantastic time at this wonderful Game Camp!

review: superb accommodation. hot water bottles put in beds in the evening which was a nice touch.  Had mosquito nets and plug in repellent so tents were mosquito free.  didnt get any bites.  The staff are so friendly and helpful. .  Caters for vegetarians and offers huge choice.  Celebrated my daughters 21st birthday.   delicious cake brought in by the staff who were singing and dancing.  It was just awesome.  Unforgettable experience.  African entertainment was good too.  Loved every minute of our stay.
title: Best place for a perfect stay at masai mara

review: From check in to check out, we were well looked after. excellent rooms considering in the middle of a National reserve. Power available for 18hrs only but this wasn't missed. The buffet had a good spread, with dinner being the best. A nice bar too! The room had the basic toiletries and tea/ coffee machine but we had to remind the staff to replenish, which was done immediately. Many thanks to my travel agent, Mara Gates Safaris/ Agnes for arranging this perfect trip. internet service was good.
title: Camp Sarova stay

review: Our stay at Camp Sarova was fantastic. An unforgettable experience. They offered great accommodations and in such a remote place!  Service and food were terrific. Would love to come back sometime!  I highly recommend Camp Sarova if you visit the Mara.
title: Trip of a lifetime

review: Luxury stay. Great Property. Located amidst the Masai mara reserve and spread across a huge area. Has a lot of capacity and the rooms are really clean and good. well behaved and very welcoming staff. Food is good and it has got the Indian feeling to it.
title: Experience Mara with Sarova Mara

review: Game drives in Mara are as much exhausting as they are fun. So to come back to the game camp after a day's drive is pure bliss.  Pros: 1. Excellent property with very friendly and professional staff.  2. The tented accomodations are truly gratifying and comfy. 3. They have an exhaustive menu for the buffets. 4. There are 20 to 30 minute activities/cultural events every evening. They don't get long enough to become boring. 5. Property is fenced. So safety is not a worry. 6. Located within the Mara national park. So you can go out to game drives early and return late.  7. It is very close to the park entrancce. So if you are all beaten up after the drive from Nairobi through terrible roads, you can immediately get into the property and relax, or,  refresh quickly and go on for a
title: An abode of luxury within the game park

review: Nice friendly staff that try hard but just lack a little bit of experience in hospitality. Plenty of opportunities to see the native African animals in there natural environment but be warned the roads around Kenya aren't the best
title: Best Vacation Ever

review: My hosts were very skilled at making you feel welcome and at home. When my family and I arrived, without an introduction, we were greeted by our family name. Shortly afterwards, Mr. Kioko Musyoki the manager met us and assured us that his staff would be willing to handle any need we may have. We spent 3 wonderful nights here in late July August. Hence the nights were a little chilly as these were the Mara’s winter months. Dinner was international and we had a variety of choices from Indian to African to Chinese and we truly enjoyed it all. For dessert you have to try the vanilla pudding with the custard sauce. It was delicious and you will go back for seconds!!  After dinner we would normally return to our tents where our beds prepared and warmed for the night.  Nutritious box
title: The Beautiful Experience

review: Fourth visit and last. We stayed there for 5 nights and got served the same food every meal. By the third day I could say which dish will be there and where it will be positioned. And to add to that no flavor at all in most.   As positives - great staff ( friendly and accommodating) good clean lodges which makes your stay very nice.  On a downside this is always a bit far from most game activity so if your staying here it's to enjoy the lodge and food. If you want more animal action then this is not recommended.
title: Disappointing food

review: What a wonderful property.  The grounds are gorgeous, from the lobby/dining area, the pool and the winding trails to all of the beautiful tent accommodations.  Tents are clean, comfortable and scenic.  Food was delicious and varied every night.  Wait staff was very accommodating and friendly.  The bar area was a great meeting place with good drinks, music and educational sessions too.    Unquestionably the best part of our stay was interacting with the manager, Kioko and his wonderful staff at the Boma Dinner.  We were celebrating two birthdays and our friends return to his Kenyan homeland.  What started as a standard dinner erupted into singing and dancing with the chef, the wait staff, front desk, the Maasai, everyone.  The guitar player (I'm so sorry I can't remember his
title: Can't say enough good things about this hotel and staff!

review: Well recommended. Great location in the reserve.  Service is good. Food was good. Nice tents. Would be great to include a gym. Wi-Fi throughout the place. Was nice to have a coffee /tea break in the afternoon and pool for whoever wants (would be good to extent the hours though).
title: Excellent hotel, well-located

review: We spent three nights with our three kids. Very comfortable tented rooms, well-equipped. The hotel amenities are suited for the environment with a pool (a bit cold, but this is due to the climatic conditions), a restaurant serving a variety of dishes (including Continental) although I really enjoyed the Indian dishes. The only issue we had was post-vacations and probably had nothing to do with the hotel: my Amex account was hacked and two large amounts were unjustly debited from my account during our stay there for (1) furniture from a Nairobi store and (2) a hot-air balloon trip in the Masai area. Luckily Amex recognised the fraud, so, hopefully, nothing to do with the hotel.
title: Great experience

review: This hotel is good, right in the middle of the best collection of big game in Kenya. Many elephants, lions, giraffe and so many wildabeasts. Tents are nice, foods varied and not bad. We enjoyed our experience.  Also visited a  Maasai village right outside the gate.
title: Best animal viewing

review: The road to this camp is quite bumpy; however, once you reach the camp it is quite lovely. The tents are really more like individual rooms with a tent feel. My husband is 6'6" tall so he did have to duck while walking in the tent. He did not complain as the setting was beautiful. We did have rain both days we were there so we did not get to enjoy the setting as much as we would have liked. We did start our day there with a balloon ride over the Masai Mara which I would highly recommend. Seeing the migration from up above was quite the sight.
title: Great Setting

review: Dusty, bumpy road to the hotel from Nairobi, BUT it is ALL worth it, located in the center of the Masai Mara Game Reserve, excellent staff, very helpful, food was great, great restaurant great breakfast, OMG what a location!
title: Located in the center of the MASAI MARA GAME RESERVE

review: May my pictures speak a gazillion words!   Thank you Mr. Kioko for the warm welcome. Thank you Mr. Knickson for the tantalizing food and great service. Thank you Mr. Moh for the crazy cocktails. Thank you Sarova Mara!
title: Unbeatable! For real...

review: Me and my husband travelled to Kenya and Zanzibar this September using the travel company Exoticca and we could not have had a more wonderful time. The trip was smartly organised and we found ourselves to be well looked after, which is always a worry when travelling to new countries you have never been to before.  This was the second camp we stayed in whilst on safari and we were just as happy with its quality. I was concerned about camping, as my husband is very critical of the places we stay and I am not an outdoorsy type of person. However, my expectations were completely wrong as the accommodations were closer to hotels than the tents that I despised as a child. I think people call this type of camping, “glamping”. All I can say is my husband didn’t complain once about this,
title: Perfect location for an amazing safari experience

review: We loved spending time at the Sarova Mara Game Camp. The tent is lovely and spacious. Just a short walk to the restaurant and other amenities. Great food. Wonderful massages for reasonable prices. And the animals we saw on our game drives were amazing. Can't say enough about our wonderful experience.
title: "Camping" at its best

review: We spent here 3 night in December 2017..happy to say it exceeded expection smooth check - in. Great service. Good food.friendly staff We impressed with the level of service. The tent was specious and hot water shower also very fast. The beds are large. And very comfortable. Wifi in tent very good. We saw many many animal also lion cheetah lepord elephant buffelo rhino Near mara sarova tented camp. my family loved staying here. Thanks Naijul shah and family  Kitale  Kenya
title: Masaimara

review: nice rooms with fresh hair ,nice and delicious food ,wonderfull swimming pool ,the place has trees that has fresh hair i saw monkeys walking in the the which was a wonderfull experience the service was superb both on the dinning and rooms
title: wonderful place

review: My favourite thing to say about the Game Camp is THE FOOOOOOOOOD!! We stayed there for 4 nights and every meal had a different theme ( breakfast / lunch / dinner ), super well thought of. Great chefs and taste as well, with fresh ingredient! If you love indian food than you are at the best place for it, as well FANTASTIC Swahilian food -- which is rather new to me as a Canadian and I loved it!!   The staffs are kind and very responsive to any questions. They were also very curious  to talk to the guests and learn about where they came from.  My most appreciated moment is their daily event involving the guests to learn about the Maasai community. It had inspired many guests seeing how positive and resourceful they are -- as well great respect to live with Nature. Which is
title: Happy Glamping!
Friendly staffs and an excellent game drive

review: We just got back from our March Safari and although I have never taken the time to write a review of a place we have stayed before, I had to make an exception here. During our travels throughout the world we have stayed in every type of accomodation, from Just OK to Incredible and everything in between. The Sarova Mara ranks up there with the best. The entire Camp and Grounds were immaculate, Lush and beautiful with baby Dik-Dik Antelopes roaming the camp. The Tents were spacious and clean with a large bathroom and shower, the service was impecable and professional and the entire staff genuinely friendly and accomodating. The camp is located right at the doorstep of the Masai Mara with a Masai Village that you can visit not far away. I can't imagine anyone not totally enjoying
title: Could Not Have Been Better
Now This is My Idea of Camping!

review: We have stayed in many beautiful hotels in our 23 years of marriage but none quite like the Sarova Mara Tented Lodge.  This was my idea of an ideal camping trip which combined the luxury and comfort of a very nice hotel, surrounded by grounds and landscape that could be in a nice, smaller hotel on Kauai, with 3 delicious and varied buffet meals every day.  Staying in these comfortable and substantial tents with large showers and flushing toilets was a real pleasure.  We had complete privacy but with the "sort-of" adventuresome feeling of being in the great outdoors.  The service was wonderful, too.  There are no phones so a wake-up call to get you up early enough for your sunrise hot-air balloon ride was a very nice gentleman lightly tapping on your tent with the pleasant
title: Good Value

review: I wish to Thank Mara Sarova camp for upgrading my Guest with no extra charges. the Leah waters group was upgrade to superior called club tent.my guest have visited Mara sarova for a number of times and it was kind of Mara sarova upgrading them at no cost. I wish to thank the management and the staff for hosting my guest with very high respect. Asante sana.
title: Thank you for Upgrade

review: It was certainly one of the best experiences of my life!!!  A little peace of heaven after an exciting game... Excellent location! Nice staff, excellent restaurant and amazing tents! 6 stars... I'll certainly come back.
title: Amazing!...

review: A super hotel with friendly staff and good food. We're celebrating out Golden Wedding and like their sister hotels they went out of their was to make it a memorable occasion. Thank you. We found the tented accommodation to be very good and was not like living in a tent at all. Comfortable bed and plenty of hot water. The only draw back was the journey to it. 60 km (2 hours) of very rough, corrugated and often flooded rock track to get there. Good news for future visitors, there is a new road in the process of being laid. Given the size of the task I don't imagine completion will be any time soon.
title: Wonderful stay

review: Food and drinks, best culinary in the bush. Best location in the Mara especially during rainy season. While it becomes problematic to do game drives and access most other camps in Masai Mara, Sarova Game Camp is accessible all year round with ease.
title: Food and Location

review: This is a permantelt  tented camp surrounding a permanent buildings with all the common areas that are quite pleasant. There are no steps to the tents. The tents are comfortable but there didn't  seem to be any heat-0nly a hot water bottle in the bed. Also no cooling source so must use natural breeze in tents. The bar and food areas were nice and the staff very friendly. The safari in this area is wonderful so staying in this camp so close is a great idea.
title: Sarova Mara camp

review: We have just returned from a Safari holiday where we spent 3 nights in the tented accomadation. We were a little concerned before arriving as to what to expect but we can only say the accomadation was brilliant. It far exceeded our expectations and our only disappointment was that the tent we were in had no view and looked directly into bushes, where as some had wonderful views of the plain and of the waterhole. However as you are in the tent generally only to sleep and to change for dinner etc then in no way did it or could it have spoilt what was a wonderful stay. I would recommend this accomadation to anyone and would say if you are worried about staying in a tent then don't be as this can hardly be discribed as a tent other that the fact it is made from canvas. The staff
title: Fantastic

review: the stay at sarova mara was beyond expectation and the safari and show by the masai,s were absolutely fantastic the food was excellent and the staff very friendly..... its camping with luxury if you dont want to be out in the jungle..... to listen in the morning at daybreak to all the birds and animals was so unbelievable as you only see this in tv...its an unforgettable experience and i would definitely want to go there again
title: Beware the Cheap Tent category

review: Were you ever a boy scout? Then you will feel at home. Moldy canvas. Furniture is junk. Floor canvas. Cement floor in bathroom. Glad we had our tent experience on our limited budget but don't expect much.  Buffet was good. Maasi dancers were very cool. Of course the Mara.......there are no words!
title: You will love this on safari

review: We stayed at all of the Sarova lodges and hotels during our stay in Kenya.  This was by far the best and is like an oasis in the middle of the savanna.  The "tents" aren't really tents in the traditional sense of the word - they have hard floors, proper beds and en-suite bathrooms!  Expect to see the odd lizard - you are in a tent in the middle of a game park after all!  The housekeeping and other customer service is excellent.  All staff are extremely warm, friendly and really make it home from home.  The lodge itself is set in well kept grounds, with a security fence that prevents any stray animals wandering in.  The food is buffet style, with a large choice and good quality.  Drinks in the bar (which has a lovely open fire and "around the camp fire" feel) are reasonably
title: You can't call this Camping!!!

review: Sarova Mara Game Camp was fantastic. There are a lot of activities to choose. Kids never got bored and had fun. We enjoyed their food too. The tent we stayed was cozy and confortable and made us relaxed all the time. We can't wait to stay at this hotel again. We love Sarova Mara Game Camp!!
title: THE BEST HOTEL

review: Generous and genuine hospitality is the hallmark is this camp. Excellent facilities, comfortable tents and great location. One of the best curio shop you would see in any hotels!! Do buy!  We have sent many Maasai dances in Mara, the one which happens in at the camp is best.   And how can we forget Martin!!! He is a great guy who was always smiling and chatting with us, making sure everything is going well.   Highly recommended for your next visit..
title: The best in Mara

review: Loved staying at Sarova Mara with my family.  It was their first time on a multi day safari.  The pool was great.  We all got massages.  The tents were smaller than others I’ve stayed in but were very nice.  Love the turn down service and hot water bottles.
title: Glamping

review: Our 4 night stay at Sarova was absolutely amazing. From the moment we met our driver Antony we knew we were in good hands. His knowledge of the area is invaluable and he went the extra mile every day to ensure we had the best game drives. Including arranging breakfast in the wild one morning! His driving was impeccable and we felt safe and comfortable at all times with Antony.  A special mention to all of the staff at the Game Camp - it was my birthday and they arranged a cake, sung and danced for me. I felt very special. Everyone was incredibly kind and nice. The food was amazing, the tent was always extra clean and the hotties in the bed at night were such a special treat. I cannot recommend this more. A special mention to Jacqueline who seated us every day in the restaurant,
title: The best Safari experience in the Maasai Mara

review: 2 nights wasn’t enough. I loved sleeping listening to the frogs and crickets. The camp is very nicely laid out. The pool was wonderful to rest at in the afternoons. They served tea in the afternoon, it was a nice touch. The food was good, all buffet style. The staff is very friendly.
title: Love the Tents

review: The setting is beautiful and the staff is superb. The standard, family and club room tents all offer glamping at its best! The entire staff is friendly and courteous. Breakfast, lunch and dinner offer a wide array of offerings—all delicious. My favorites were the custom-made soups and salads—not to mention the warm bread puddings with custard and a variety of toppings. Mohammed is the friendly bartender who has been there 10 years and serves his customers with flair and attention to detail.  Maureen in the gift shop welcomes you with a beautiful smile and assists you with the perfect take-home gifts. It is a wonderful gift shop with a great selection of gifts. Many activities are available for families and guests. I hope to return some day!
title: Glamping!

review: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the camp everything was perfect, the whole stay was enjoyable but we really enjoyed the hot air balloon and champagne breakfast highlight of the holiday.
title: Fantastic stay staff facility's food all excellent

review: An awesome place to stay. Very friendly and helpful hotel staff. Many Choices of food. It is an eco hotel and the rooms are basically tents. An excellent experience. Located in the forest reserve area.
title: Ms

review: Things don’t always go as planned when traveling, but problems take on new proportions when they occur in a remote area halfway around the world. That’s how our experience with the Sarova Mara Game Camp began.  Learning of premium “Club Tent” accommodations was the inspiration behind our decision to change our reservations from the Ashnil Mara Camp to the Sarova Mara Game Camp, and, indeed, this specific detail was confirmed no fewer than three times prior to our stay. Yet, on our arrival on Christmas Day, my wife and I, like Mary and Joseph in Bethlehem, were denied our accommodations, being told that our Club Tent was assigned to another party for whatever reason. All euphoric feelings of being immersed in Kenyan hospitality up to that point were suddenly dashed, and we found
title: Rescued by the Better Angels of Hospitality

review: Large tented camp.  Large comfortable tents.  Very family friendly.  Good food - buffet but they will get you pretty much whatever you ask for.  After a week of safaris at 3 different camps, long rides on dirt roads, my daughter and I both had excellent massages.  Nice facilities - swimming pool, volleyball etc.  Because you are inside the National Reserve, you are on safari as soon as you leave the camp.
title: Great camp inside the Reserve

review: Everything about this Game Lodge was good. The restaurant, the food, the bar, the staff. We had a wonderful time, and would not hesitate to recommend this location to anyone. A fabulous way to close out our magical holiday to Kenya
title: Awesome holiday with the fanilt

review: We chose Masai Mara, Kenya for our honeymoon and we chose Sarova Mara Game Camp based on the reviews here at the tripadvisor and our trip was just so full of surprises and a masterpiece in service and hospitality if I may.  Kellen (Sales) was our single point of contact for the entire booking (Sarova Mara and Sarova Stanley at Nairobi). She was very professional and really went up and ahead to make sure that everything was perfectly planned for us.I must really thank her.   Surprise#1: On reaching Sarova Mara, we firstly realized that we have been upgraded to the Club Tent (#66) overlooking the periphery. The tent was really good and comfortable having all the luxury and privacy. They had prepared special arrangements for us for our honeymoon before hand which was really
title: One our our most memorable experiences
Our visit to Masai Mara November 2017

review: This is amazing place.  We had excellent two nights here.  Very friendly staff, very clean and five star tents, well equipped and comfortable.  We had excellent trip, can't praise this place enough, nice dinner, so much choice, nice entertainment in the evening and we took packed breakfast which wasn't bad as we didn't want to come back for breakfast.  This hotel believes in giving you best time.  They put hot water bottle in the bed every night for  us.
title: Excellent Hotel

review: This is a dream come true!  You truely feel as if you a part of a bygone time.  Don't get put off by the "Tents".  These are not your girl(or boy)scout weekend in the wilderness type tents.  They all are on individual hard wood floors.  Each tent has an attached stone bathroom.  Each tent faces out onto the Mara and you have your own "private" porch to relax on.  You might even get some visitors like I did.  Two tiny Dic-Dics (the smallest antelope in the world) came right up to me and into my tent just to say hello one afternoon!  There were also some salamanders visiting my bathroom overnight.  The lodge is in the center of the game reserve.  Right in the action.  At night you can hear the lions roaring not too far off in the distance, elephants bellowing and baboons
title: The Lion Sleeps Tonight

review: This was our 2nd trip back on safari to Kenay with Somak Holidays and without a doubt was incredible. We stayed for 3 nights in tent # 12A as part of our 6 day safari and how we loved it. The staff were excellent  from the very efficient check in at reception to the marvellous buffet style meals. With excellent attention to detail plus what more can you ask for than to be awoken by song bird and Elephants talking to oneanother , no need to worry though as the camp is very secure. The Dik Dik's were so sweet and 2 of them slept at the back of our tent at night  - how wonderful! That part of the Masai Mara was teaming with wildlife and we even saw Cheetah close up this time. After the game drives , we would head for the lovely rustic looking bar and have a glass or two before our
title: Loved this Tented Camp
Sarova Lodges in the Maasai Mara and Lake Nakuru

review: We loved the Masai Mara Game Reserve and the Sarova Mara Tented Camp.  The tents are very comfortable and the showers have plenty of hot water.  The pool is very cool and refreshing also.  The bed was a little firm, but still comfortable.  They even have turn down service and your wake up call is someone coming to your tent at the wake-up time requested.  There is no a/c, but we did not find that it was needed (there is electricity).  All food is served buffet style, with drinks extra.  Overall, a beautiful and comfortable place.
title: Best experience ever!

review: The best place in Mara to go with your loved one to enjoy the beautiful Mara. Excellent service, food delicious and fresh.  Muhamed the bar man made extra fun keeping our drinks topped and fresh new cocktails made perfectly. Couldn’t fault anything. Friendly staff, clean rooms. A definite return here to relax and enjoy the Mara.
title: Wedding anniversary

review: Definitely not roughing it.  The attached bathroom was a pleasure to use.  The shower is lovely.  Bed was comfortable as well. Dining room had good service.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Good selection of food.  The only dish I did not enjoy was the fish.  It was too dry, overcooked for my taste buds.  The pasta station was excellent and the soups were all very tasty. Laundry service was good and reasonable. Hint:  Make sure you turn off the outside light of your tent.  It will reduce the number of unwanted visitors into your tent.  We had a few large bugs in the tent which we carefully carried over to the fly and let them go.  The animals are also noisy at night, so if you are a light sleeper, take ear plugs with you. We definitely enjoyed our stay here and the bush
title: Good accommodation  Glampling

review: We spent the maximum time of our safari in Mara, so it was important that the accommodation be up to the mark. Happy to say it exceeded expectations - smooth check in, great service, good spread in the buffet and very friendly and lively staff. Impressed with the level of service.  The 'tent' was spacious, the beds large and comfortable, the wifi worked quite well. The ensuite toilet was brick and mortar, curtained off from the sleeping area, had running hot water. If it had a door or a zippered flap - something that could shut the toilet off from the beds/sleep area, slight privacy issue with the curtain for one member of my family.  I asked for some extra coffee sachets for the in-room tray and was positively flooded with them. There was a mix-up with my laundry, but it was
title: A home in the bush.

review: what an amazing experience ! we were treated very well right from the welcome to the last good bye. my wife fell ill, the in house doctor was competent and gave the right treatment (both me and my wife are doctors) food was perfect with such good choices. the pool and bar area were quite cosy. we stayed in a club tent and it was huge, could compare to any hotel room. we actually heard lions roar in the night but feeling safe that the electric fences surrounding the camps would do the job! the downside was the entertainment in the evening only as we had just travelled from sarova's property in nakuru with fantastic entertainment.  try to go for all day drive with packed lunch
title: fantastic african hospitality

review: The true theme of a wild Masai safari is continued when you walk through the lobby of this hotel. A wooden bridge over a small brook and you are confronted by a large wooden statue dressed up in traditional Masai garb. Your host greets you with a beverage and check-in is sorted out in 5 minutes. Very efficient!  Your porter is very helpful if giving details about the property. He even showed me where the elephants sometimes come to water just behind my tent. The property is spread throughout a spacious green area. Trees and shrubs shadow over every tent to ensure that the dominant colour you see is green. You may even see some fawn running around the hotel. There’s a small pool, a kiddies pool and a spa surrounded by several deckchairs. A table tennis table is also close by.
title: Oasis in the Mara

review: After spending two days at Mara Serena, this tented lodge was a huge letdown. The accommodation itself was ok, but the service left a lot to be desired. The positives about this lodge are probably its location, near Keekorok lodge, in an area where we saw all the big five within a 2 hour game drive, and its restaurant. The negatives include the experience of the staff and the service they provide, and the overall high prices for the value received.  The rooms are tented, all with ensuite bathrooms, and occasional dik-dik antelopes who may visit in the mornings. Our room seemed to be a favorite of a family of slugs - there was one on the wooden chest in the room, and some babies in the shower stall. The bed was comfortable, mosquitoes weren't a problem, thanks to an electric
title: 4 out of big 5

review: Well, what can I say - this place is absolutely magical. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we felt like royalty! The place itself is lovely, very tastefully and discreetly put together - you can't see any of the luxury tents until you're right next to them. There are beautiful gardens and a lovely pool with sunbathing area which is idylic. The people are great, friendly, kind, fun, discreet, and they can't do enough for you. In particular, Edward by the pool is a great guy.   The tents are great - well, they're not really tents at all and all have luxury permanent bathrooms with lovely hot showers which are really appreciated after the morning and evening game drives which can get very cold indeed. The beds are comfortable and you have everything you need.   The
title: Magical

review: When we booked our safari, we had to book a club tent as the cheaper option was all sold out.  At the time, we weren't impressed, but now we are so glad that happened.  The club tents are just beyond beautiful - we wanted to move in!  Sitting outside on the patio, on a wonderful hand made chair, watching the elephants go by was perfection.  I can't do it justice, but the photos can!  Food was great - and the staff were really friendly.
title: Beyond Beautiful

review: Resort is beautiful. Not anything like camping!! Service is first rate. Great location. We saw animals right outside the resort. Game drives were great! William, our guide was excellent!
title: Excellent!!

review: I was at this hotel in 2005 and couldn't wait to come back.    The food is very good.  The staff is quite friendly.  Our driver from the hotel (who we requested to be the same as last time) is the best!  He went out of his way to try to help us spot a rhino (with no luck though).    The rooms are very nice and clean.  Beds are comfortable.  And the bathrooms are normal - with showerheads in the wall and not those annoying European "telephone" style things.    The grounds are just peaceful.  I really enjoy staying at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone coming to the Mara.
title: Love this place

review: I stayed at the Sarova Mara Lodge during a quick 36 hour safari excursion  while I was in Kenya for business.   I was there with 9 business colleagues.  We sprung for the upgrade and stayed in "Club" tents.  They were AMAZING.  All of the furniture was hand made, the bathrooms were well appointed, and clean.  I wish I could have stayed a week.  This didn't feel like a tent, the floors and ceiling were permanent, as was the bathroom.  The walls were canvas - so you get the best of both worlds.  I walked by some of the "standard tents", I recommend you upgrade, it was WELL worth it.  All the staff was very very kind and attentive.  Our bartender, Moses, was hilarious.  My porter, Joseph, was prompt and very friendly.  Our waiter, Daniel, took very good care of us at every meal.
title: Not your "standard" tent

review: If you are considering Kenya in a wheelchair, you need to be aware that facilities are not perfect but with the right attitide and approach it is still an option.  The luxury tents at Sarova Mara are spacious enough that moving around the room is relatively easy.  The bathroom is quite small - but does have a grab rail near the toilet ( not in the best spot ) but helpful none the less.  The shower has no grab rail and no shower chair - however we used the wooden one from the balcony and it was ok. The tent we had was considered a wheelchair accessible room which  you would need to request.  As far as the dining room and general facilities go - the camp was fantastic and the Mara is a must see.
title: A possibility for Disabled travellers

review: This lodge was one of our favorites. Excellent buffet, very comfortable tents and nice bathrooms attached to the tent, a great atmosphere. Very friendly service and payable with creditcard in TZS. (not in Dollars see my review about Sopa lodge Tarangire)
title: Excellent stay

review: Sarova are always good quality and Mara Sarova is no exception. We spent two days here and two days at Mara Siria. Can't complain about Sarova, but we much preferred Siria, which is smaller and more of a bush camp. Sarova has a pool, paved walkways, bar etc. Siria is at the top of an escarpment so the views are incredible. Sarova is surrounded by greenery so you miss that, plus it's just much bigger- great if that's what you want. Rooms lovely and comfortable with large beds and great bathroom with electricity and mod cons. We had some great Masai dancing and the children liked the little shop. Drinks expensive, but no real surprise. We negotiated a cheaper rate before we arrived but it's still expensive- but you know what you're getting. This would suit a lot of people and we
title: Lovely place, but another big hotel.
...... Beautiful, Wonderful, Beautiful....... Did I say Wonderful? Ours was a fairy tale story.

review: Finding great accommodation in the Mara at this time is something unbelievable since the place is fully booked.  I remember walking into Bunson and being told that there are no rooms available at the best places in the Mara...... So finding a room in the Sarova was out of this world....... we decided to walk to the Stanley where I bumped into  a very good friend of mine Mr. Shisia; the health club manager.  I explained to him that my fiancee and I had been trying so hard to get accommodation in the Mara with no luck...... He told us to go to the central reservations as fast as possible and we would get assisted. Dreams do come true guys.... We easily got accommodation and it was just unbelievable.   On arrival to the Mara, the reception was great. Our room was not yet ready so
title: excelllent stay!

review: Sadly our stay in this beautiful spot was marred by mosquito problems. In the rooms they have a mosquito killing device that heats a scented disk. It was moderately effective, but only when the power was on. The electricity is run off a generator which is turned off from midnight until early morning. We were woken repeatedly on our first night from the sound of mosquitoes by our ears and when we finally got up in the morning we both had close to a dozen bites on our faces. That day I complained about the problem (as did the majority of guests there) and pleaded for a mosquito net for the bed. Turns out they were aware of the mosquito issue. The outbreak had started two months ago, but since this was the first year they have had problems they were taking a hope-it-goes-away
title: Beware: Malarial zone mosquito outbreak since May. Tents are not sealed and there is no bed netting.

review: The food is good, the location great, the grounds decent. But the service at this hotel is sadly lacking. On arrival, despite the usual provision of towels and juice to freshen up with, you will be treated in a brusque manner, presented with paperwork the staff will not attempt to help you with (you must fill in forms for each room to save them the effort of duplicating it themselves) and be generally got out of the way so the next batch of tourists can be dealt with. The rooms are often not properly serviced as well.  The real unforgiveable thing at this place was the lack of mosquito nets in the 'tents'. Given that there is a large pond amongst the tents, and the tents are very easy for mosquitoes and other insects to invade the lack of nets is simply idiotic. The ineffectual
title: great place to stay

review: A  wonderful 2 days we spent here. It was a flawless show . Do spend some time at the pavilion over the lily pond during the lazy afternoons ; it is a very peaceful place . The Indian food was authentic . The buffet had amazing variety for a place so far removed from civilization but then this is a big property . The tents are all secluded in their own little patch of real jungle.  The only drawback is that the location is a bit removed from the " business district " so to speak . But we saw plenty of wildlife on the way to and fro the " downtown " areas - no regrets . Fully recommended .
title: Amazing!!!!!

review: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our two day stay at the Mara Sarova.  Tent: Our standard room consisted of hardwood floors, king size bed (on the firm side), granite countertops in the bathroom and a built in ceramic tile shower.  Definitely not roughing it.  Just zippers on the front, if you're concerned about your stuff, you might consider bringing a lock (we brought locks, but passed on locking it up in order to allow for housekeeping during the day).  Tent was very clean.    The service was excellent.  No wifi and the charge to use the business center / internet seemed steep (maybe $5 USD for 15 minutes?)  Grounds were nice and well kept.    Game Drives The Mara’s so big that you’ll definitely see everything, but you could probably go stretches without seeing anything.
title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay

review: I took my adult son with me on a business trip to Nairobi and decided to take a few days and visit Masai Mara. Bunson Travel recommened Sarova Mara Tented Camp, amoung a few others, but we settled on Sarova. What a great experience! Everything was great. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Food was fabulous, facilities are very well maintained. We used their safari game driver, Ken, who was really really great. We just couldn't have asked for a better experience in Kenya. I slept better here than I do in most hotels. When is the last time you got a hot water bottle in your bed, because the night air was a bit on the cool side. Highly recommend.
title: Tasteful deco

review: I booked this place for my in-laws' first African safari.  I sifted through a lot of camps before choosing it.  tented camps have become sucha a fad in East Africa recently that I've been a bit concerned that it's a category in which 'anything goes'.  I wanted to avoid the places that just throw up some tarp over a cement floor and try to ride the trend.  Sarova Mara Camp was not like that at all. They really do the 'tented camp' with panache.  In the bush it is really good taste and attention to detail (IMHO) that really makes a place.  I think this can be especially important for first-timers in Africa.  The whole group felt very well taken care of here, and I felt it was good value for money.  It's useful to know that the food is quite Indian, which I love but my guests grew
title: sarova hotels

review: This is a great hotel, we stayed there 2 nights during our honeymoon and we loved all of it, since we arrived till we said goodbye. They gave us a special tent, with a really nice and big bed, very confortable. The walk to the tent was special, because we always saw some diferent animals on the way, dik dik antilopes, mangoose, birds, really nice. The food was also very good and staff was very friendly too. We recomend it!!
title: A great hotel for safary - beautifull tent

review: This June i made my second trip to Kenya and it was special because it was also my first anniversary. We had kept two nights and three days for our stay in Mara and as advised by people went in for Sarova Mara Game Camp. The ultimate part of the experience was we were taken in a four seater flight from Nairobi to the Kikorok air strip. Once we landed int the kikorok strip, edward from Sarova Mara was waiting for us. He mentioned that he is going to be our guide for the entire trip and he would also take care of our game drives. We appreciated this as one point of contact is always better to get better service. One thing to mention is entirely through the trip all the people in Sarova Camp used to greet us whenever we see them...Gives a calming feeling  Once we entered the camp
title: The camp to stay when you travel to Mara

review: Rooms: 51 standard, 2 family and 20 superior.  The standard rooms are a typical canvas tent with zip door. Very clean, spacious and in tranquil surroundings. The same can be said of the club tents.  However, club tents have superior furnishings, very large and stylish en-suite facilities, hairdryer, bath robes, slippers tea and coffee making facilities and a mini bar.  They also have lockable wooden and glass doors which lead onto a decking area with relaxing furnishings.    Restaurant: large dining area, including outside dining area.  A large selection of food including good choice from the “live” station.  Served in chaffing dishes which are kept replenished.  Typical costs are Tusker 300/kes and soda 200/kes.  Facilities: there is a huge range of facilities at the Sarova
title: Lovely but crowded

review: We have just returned after a wonderfuld holiday at the Masai Mara. This was a short business trip coupled with this long awaited trip to the Masai Mara.   Our trip was arranged by a travel agent in Nairobi. I should admit they have done a wonderful job. This was a 3 day trip (2 nights). We were given an 8 seater Toyota van. Our driver was an experienced guy who was doing these safari trips for the last 20 years (lucky guy). We reached the Masai Mara in about 5 and half hours. The ride was a little bumpy one.   We checked into the Mara Sarova jungle camp. What an experience to see a wonderful camp in the midst of the jungle. The camp has luxurious tents where we had a wonderful stay for the next 2 days. The restaurants / food / staff / their attitude and service was excellent.
title: Wonderful Game Reserve

review: Spent the valentine weekend here, woke up to find heart shaped choc cookies on dressing table, dinner was served under the star lit canopy (outdoor), with live music and a truely romantic atmosphere. I am not one for camping, but the tented accomodation was a luxury I would take time and again if afforded. In tent facilities included, electric kettle with tea and coffee, bottles of  drinking water, beds turned and hot water bottle slipped in bed at night etc. Lights go off at midnight...candles and torch provided.  The food i.e. breakfast, lunch and dinner was exceptional.  All the staff throughout the resort were very friendly, polite and helpful. My son was feeling unwell (travelling and early morning safaris for game) and the doctor was summoned immediately to offer advice,
title: Customer Service at its' best

review: Sarova Mara is a tented camp.  The tents were smaller then those we stayed at previously.  Tall people hit their heads walking past the beds.  The tents are set in the bush so there are no views.  Some are quite a walk from the dining area.  The staff are friendly and very helpful.  It is not as far into the park as some accommodation.  The rains had started early so lots of animals had already migrated but even so, we still had plenty to see including two cheetah familes and leopard.
title: Great place

review: This is a beautiful lodge/ Tent camp. We stayed for three nights and really enjoyed the entire manicured area. Our stay was in a permanent tent with a deck over a small creek. We had visitors outside our deck with a cute little hyraxe in his hole in the tree and some vervet monkeys with a baby coming down to visit us in the evening. We could here the roar of some lions at night as we found out the next day they brought down a Zebra and we got some great photos. This is a great property to stay at with excellent service and magnificent grounds to enjoy.  We will be back again soon.  Bob & Linda
title: BEAUTIFUL TENT CAMP

review: We had a great time last October.  Tents are comparatively large, very clean, hardwood floors, roll up sides.  All of the convenience of a lodge, with the quaintness of a tent.  Food is good (buffets), very hospitable and close to full game areas.  It is a distance from the Mara crossing, but the camp will supply you with a "box lunch" (en lieu of a lunch at the camp) where you can spend the full day on your game drive and stop for lunch at your convenience.  We took a leisurly game drive, stopped at the Tanzanian border, had a ranger tour of the hippos and crocks at the river and then saw two crossings, before we stopped at a designated tree area  for our lunch.  Tents near rhe bridge and pond are great as you can sit on your porch and say hello to other guests as the go to and
title: Great Hospitality, excelent Accomodations
Great place when not too crowded

review: I stayed here when tourists were still too scared to go to Kenya - so only 10 of the 70+ tents at the compound were occupied.  My deluxe tent was gorgeous, huge and with nice and comfortable furniture.  It had a nice deck and great cell phone reception.  I couldn't really have been happier with the room.  The resort itself is nice, though I think it'd be too crowded during a regular tourist season.  The staff was friendly, efficient and accommodating.  The food was OK but I really enjoyed the safaris.
title: More than we expected

review: Sarova Mara is one of the best stay site if one has to go to Masai Mara. It is right inside the Masai Jungles , where one can see animals in their natural habitat. Big five animals can be found in the Jungle through Safari conducted both early morning and after noon by the Hotel Guide. Must go and watch Big Five ( Lion, Rhino, Elephant, Wild Beast, Giraf)
title: Near Nature like never before.

review: We stayed here as part of a two week safari, where we stayed at both this camp and also the Mara Serena. The Mara Serena was advertised as being the more upmarket & better positioned withi the Mara but we in fact enjoyed our stay more at the Sarova. The 'tents' were clean and roomy, they weren't as upclass as some of the other tented camps but they were still very nice, the only downside really was there was not a view from the tent decking - we just had a wire fence and bush to look at...but we were woken at 5am but a pride of Lions roaring loudly the other side of the bushes (we couldn't see them but just the noise was perhaps our best experience of the Mara in 4 trips) We did have to drive a fair distance to get into the parts of the Mara where the game was and the road was
title: Very Nice Good Value Camp!
Sort of a Tent, and Wonderful Staff

review: This was my second trip to Maasai Mara, but my first time at the Sarova Mara.  It's a "tented camp" in the sense that you are, technically, staying in a tent--if you define a tent as an accommodation with canvas sides and a zipper for a door.  But the tent has wooden floors, a permanent roof over the tent roof, a bathroom, hot and cold running water day and night, and it's serviced daily.  So not your typical camping experience.  That, by the way, is not a complaint.  It's just to put "camp" in context.  This place had probably the best staff of any place my daughter and I stayed in Kenya.  They were unfailingly helpful, polite, cheerful, and professional.  The restaurant provides a nice range of food options for all meals.  The room/tent was fine, with some cautions.  If you
title: A game safari is a lifetime experience - this hotel adds to it

review: I returned to this lodge after a gap of almost 20 years! However, all the changes seemed to be for the better... we were upgraded to club tents which were pure luxury! There is a small private area outside the tent and tents are really spacious inside; and equipped with electrical amenities / work table / separate bathrooms and toilets / great showers with HOT water; whilst retaining its 'bush' appeal... Plus the tents have their own ceiling fans which we didnt use asit was quite cold! Excellently landscaped, one can see Dik-dik and other small animals inside the lodge area (which is huge), and the walk to the dining area from the tent is through dense foliage... the pool area and garden is well maintained... food was great... staff were friendly and helpful - within a few
title: Super Lodge... Club Tents Awesome...
Start your visit of the Masai Mara at Sarova Mara Game Camp

review: We had some concerns about what a "tent camp" meant.  Not to worry; this is not backpacking in the wild with a tent on your back.  Imagine a "tent" with hardwood floors, a full-size bed, double vanity, and tiled shower.  The food selection and quality were very good, and you could spend time at the pool or the bar if you were looking for something to do between game drives.    This camp is conveniently located at the edge of the Mara, and in a few minutes we were in among the animals.  It was a great location and a very fun safari.  Notes to travelers (especially those who have not been to Africa): 1. This is a game camp, not an amusement park.  You are in the middle of a wild area - you are a guest in one of Mother Nature's best playgrounds.  So, while the large animals are
title: A super nice tent with beautiful hardwoods and granite in the jungle
Wow, not tents as I know them

review: I just got back from staying here for two nights.  It was so beautiful, it if were not so far away i would definitely go back.  The walk to my tent was a little lengthy because I was in number 68, I think, and I had to go past other tents, then cross a bridge, then walk some more to get there.  But from inside my tent, I couldn't see another tent.  I could only see and hear the jungle.  One night when I was walking to the tent, a man who works there walked me to my tent and we went a little further, closer to the mara, to look at the stars.   I have never seen anything like that.  It was like a plantetarium, only it was real.  And the noises in the jungle are so charming - all of the different birds.  When they wheeled my luggage out to my room it got a little bumped and bruised
title: 5 star jungle!!!!!

review: The staff at Sarova Mara really go the extra mile. We were greeted on arrival by a masai warrior with a cool towel to refresh after our drive.   Everything was organized seamlessly and exceeded our expectations over and over again.   At the night they turn down your bed and pop a hot water bottle in the bed to warm it up. The staff know who you are and use you name. Caroline in the restaurant was a shining star.   The food was great, the tents gorgeous and we could hear nothing but the insect and the animal calls it was impossible not to feel relaxed.   Every night there is entertainment in the bar and also Masai performances.  I would absolutely recommend this lodge to everyone.
title: the finer details that made this lodge stand apart from the rest

review: V visited their around last year and it was great. When v heard about tents v were quite confused and a bit scare as our previos stays in Nairobi were not that much pleasant  but v had never imagined that tents can be so comfortable. Reaching their was quite hazardous due to a long jumpy road but worth it. Good things : Check in and out does not take time and on arrival a staff will be giving u hot towels to fresh ur face. Dinner is excellent covering all kinds of dishes . Staff r great , they tend to hear ur problem and try to answer them as well. Service is good, v asked for an extra matress and it arrived within five minutes. The tent is provided with an electric kettle and coffee and with hit water rubber bags so if uvfeel cold u can adjust. Very near to wild life and u may
title: Expensive, but will always remember .

review: The location is amazing, so close to all the animals The tents were large, kept very clean Friendly staff, great service Laundry and internet available.  Good gift shop, well priced.
title: Expected more

review: We spent 4 nights at the Mara Sarova at the end of a 14-day safari trip.   The camp is situated within the Masai Mara boundaries but quiet a distance from the Mara River.  The latter cannot be reached on a normal morning or evening game drive.  It requires a full-day trip.  Once in the camp (jungle like garden) the feeling of being in the Masai Mara disappears somewhat.  The camp is completely disclosed from typical Masai Mara scenery.  All are tent-like rooms with a add-on for the shower.  Tents are rather small and furnished with basics.  The room and bathroom, the terrace furniture etc. all gave the impression that it was in need of some renovations.  'Shaby' would perhaps be a more correct word. Staff were extremely friendly and helpfull.  When one morning we got back too
title: Awsome

review: After a very torturous drive along the entry road we were happy to get to the lodge. One would think that the amount of money spent by tourism in this park would warrant the government to spend a little more money on an entry road. According to our guide the money is funneled off to the "Big Fish" as he categorized the corrupt politicians and contractors.  Once there, it was a wonderful experience. The lodge is perched on a hill and provides easy access to the wonders of the Maasai Mara.  Although the tents were not as nice the Ashnil tented camps, they were still excellant. Lots of room, nice outside deck, large comfrotable bed and decent bathroom. They provided hot water bottles in the evening for the beds. We could never get the staff to understand that, as Canadians, we
title: Great Location

review: During my first visit, I was very impressed by the beautiful and peaceful surroundings.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.
title: Good hotel

review: Not far from the entrance of the Mara entrance, the hotel is convenient for game drive.At the time we went the restaurant was under renovation so the buffet and seat were set at the bar, it was a long & traditional line of chaffing dishes with a few live cooking. Pasta station was horrible and the food in general was lacked of salt. The best was the grill meat where everyone was queuing for it. Room are neat & clean. You are however wake up time to time during the night due to some animal moving around during the night, but this is the nature. Fresh air but a bit cold in the evening. Lucky there is coffee/tea station where you can warm you after back from your game drive. visit the home garden where they grow perfect vegetables, the gardener were so kind to show and explain all,
title: Awesome!!!

review: Luxurious living in the heart of the reserve. The tents have all the comforts of a hotel room. The property is in tune with the surrounding. The food was excellent,  with plenty of options for vegetarians. The service was also superb. Though the generators are switched off between midnight and 5 am, on request, they readily kept them on to faciltate use of my CPAP machine at night. They arranged late lunch, early breakfast to suit our travel plans.  Wildlife viewing is very convenient from here, with plenty of game around.
title: Superb Luxury Tents

review: When we decide to go Masai Mara with my wife and 7 year old son, I was a bit worry but I ensure everybody, this is lovely and safest place for family holidays. Specially guides, hotel personnel and hospitality were great.  If you go Masai Mara, only be sure about time animal moves and rain. Everything is perfect there.
title: Great Experience in Masai

review: Best part of the lodge was being woken up nightly by the roaring of the local lions!!!  They had an electric fence so you did not have to be escorted. They did have dik-diks and baboons wandering around so just be alert.   The property was spread out. Most tents were side-by-side with a walkway between them in groups of two. If you have trouble walking then you should request a higher number tent as the lower numbers are at the other end of the property. If you have a large group ask for the family tent... two tents in the same area with a communal area of 2 couches and a table for 4.  The room was mostly the bed, desk and bath. The toilet is separate from the shower/sink area. You are given toiletries and 2 bottles of water a day.    Electricity did go off at night but you are
title: Who knew a tent could be so comfy!

review: Stayed at the Sarova Mara Game camp from June 14 to June 19, 2011. Its a beautiful property with lovely gardens, a lake and a swimming pool. We stayed in the club tents, Rooms 70 and 71 are the best on the property, at the edge of the Park , with an unrestricted view of animals grazing. The club tents are very well appointed, large and airy with all possible modern conveniences. Laundry service is prompt and inexpensive. the food is well cooked and there is a fairly large selection at all meals.The staff are friendly and helpful without being familiar. The gift store at the hotel has a wide selection of things to take back home and is priced competitively.A great experience , I would recommend this property to visitors to Masai Mara.
title: Wow it really is that good

review: Great location within the park. Animals are everywhere right outside the gates. Everything at the camp, this is not really a camp!!!!!  is first rate. Staff are incredible. Unlimited first class food.
title: Wonderful stay in sarova mara

review: We were at Sarova Mara for three amazing days of wildlife watching. The so called tents are better than some of the five star hotels and have all facilities including a proper three fixture bathroom (although with a curtain for a door!) Mosquitoes do present a problem when you move out of the tent as it is surrounded by lush vegetation so please carry some mosquito repellant cream.  The food is good across breakfast, lunch and dinner and staff is extremely cordial and helpful. The spa staff is not the same and will play hookey or try and change your appointment at the last moment so please reconfirm your appointment multiple times! The facilities for kids are great including table tennis, swimming and chess, etc. They have a gentleman called Peterson whose sole aim is to keep
title: Amazing experience of 5 Star tent living!

review: The Masai Mara National Reserve is fantastic! The hotel is also very good and they have a lot of entertainment! Very nice and welcoming staff! If one is not at the game they can go fishing or play badminton! Nice food and good overall! And very lovely tents!
title: Fantastic location and food

review: We stayed here in April 2011 as part of our Kenya safari.  This was the last hotel we stayed and so we had a fair idea of what to expect and the whole facility did exceed our expectation. Located about 5 kms inside from the main gate of the Masai Mara, this nice property is quite big and spacious. They have a very nice bar with cable TV, huge restaurant and a very nice swimming pool. They also have a small putting area for golfers.  Majority of their staff were very efficient and courteous. Some of them remember your name even if you are staying only for a short while and come across always as pleasing personalities.  we stayed in one of their standard tents and that by itself was much better than some other camps. The furnishing was tastefully and colorfully done with enough
title: Create place to take a nap and rest for a safari. Perfect.

review: Being Nairobi residents we decided to go for a 3 night stay at Mara Saroiva and have been very pleased with our stay. Staff are extremely helpful and friendly and the 'tents' among the best ones I know in Kenya. They are presently expanding and renovating but hopefully they'll maintain the same level of comfort and service. Also had an excellent guide from the camp - Ole Soit aka Daniel who took us around and showed us things I had not experienced during my may years in Kenya. Highly recommended.
title: Superb hospitality, great location, fabulous game viewing

review: the staff is incredible, especially Caroline. Went out of their way to attend to every need including allowing me to use their personal cell phone to make a call when i was not able to use the land line. The restaurant was having some renovation so we took one meal outside under a tent. The staff did a fantastic job arranging the seating and buffet outside. The food was incredible. the tent was surprisingly roomy and comfortable. Might want to bring some ear plugs as you can hear your neighbors easily at night. Being nestled in the woods meant it was comfortably cool and offered lots of birds to view.
title: african hospitality at it's finest

review: I found this place to be fab, the tents really were luxurious and the small touches like a hot water bottle in your bed when you come back from dinner, the mosquito repellent and towelettes in the bathroom - thye really made a difference. The grounds and tents were really beautiful and comfortable for anyone of any age (my father's in his 70s and was totally comfortable) What's more, it felt very safe - the tents only have a zipper and not key/locks but felt really safe on the grounds. Not much to do nor much entertainment so be sure to take something to do. The bar area had a log fire and TV which was cozy and and gives you a chance to meet other guests. Also staff were nice, food were ok and had an enjoyable couple of days here.
title: It's the smallest things that made the difference

review: We stayed here in the standard tents for one night with a family of small children. Tents showed poor maintenace with curtain flap hooks and zips not working. Lighting outside tents not working or inadequate at night. Standard tents built very close to each other and walkway pavements. Hence noise from early morning pedestrian traffic and trolleys was a nuisance and unacceptable.  Food was of excellent quality and plenty of variety.  Watchout for safety hazard for little kids at the walkover bridge over the river stream at the main lodge entrance. The bridge handrail has openings too large for unattended children.
title: Needs Upgrading

review: This is a lovely place to relax after driving through the Savannah in search of the Big 5 animals. We did see the Big 5 and so much more thanks to a skillful guide/driver. The Sarova experience was a lovely escape from the stress of the world. I happily lived without internet service, instead enjoying more simple pleasures -- like sitting around the fire in the main lodge, or lingering over the sumptuous meals. We're already planning our next trip.
title: Exceeded all my expectations!

review: * Fantastic location (it is in a forest in Masaai Mara National Reserve, has a lake and a river and little deers wander around) * FANTASTIC rooms -tents actually- (romantic, cosy, luxurius and elegant) * Great staff (very helpful, very friendly, very fast) * Great variety of food  I definately suggest it!!!
title: Fantastic!

review: We (mine and my cousin's family) stayed at Sarova Mara on 1st & 2nd of July 2011 before moving to Lake Nakuru to stay at Sarova Lion Hill.   To talk about Sarova Mara, its nothing short of a dream for all of us..... - Wonderful weather - 12 to 15d at night and about 25d during day (we went from Dubai where the weather is about 40+) - Wonderful hospitality - Excellent property / camp - Very nice food.....  We stayed in tents 74 and 75 (club tents), which is quite a bit away from the lobby. But the tent is simply superb. Each tent is independent with a lot of space between each tents (good for privacy), with wooden floor, a balcony, an interesting looking fan, seperate toilet and bathroom with hot water 24 hrs, a king size bed with a spare bed (good for 4 of us). There are no hard
title: Wonderful.......

review: We stayed at the Sarova Mara the last 2 nights of a 5 night safari trip with Rhino Tours, and they saved the best for last!
