We asked for a quiet room ahead of time via email contact, and we got room 53 which is far away from the reception area and up hill, but worth the trek!  The tent was lovely, quiet from foot traffic, and large!  A king sized bed plus a single bed for just the 2 of us.  (great place for the luggage, lol)  The only drawbacks were the 2 lizards that I found crawling across our bathroom celing one night that got in through one of the many cracks!  EEK!!  My husband stuffed towels in the holes until the staff came to solve the problem the same way.  Another night, we came back from dinner and found a rather large, strange, spider on the wall near the bed that
title: Really nice

review: Tented rooms are great. Ours was just a standard tent, but was still lovely. Food was some of the best we had in 15 days. Staff were lovely, pool was small but very clean and refreshing. Good location - saw everything we could possibly want withing a 45 minute drive at max.
title: Fantastic

review: My family (wife and 7 year old daughter) visited Kenya from the 1st to the 8th of April 2011. This was our first time.  We spent 1 night in Nairobi, 2 nights in Masai Mara, 2 nights in Nakuru and 2 nights in Amboseli in that order.  Our stay at the Sarova Mara Game Camp was simply fabulous.  The service we received was great.  The tented camp room we stayed in was better than some of the hotel rooms that are on offer these days.  Choice of food was good.  However, they kept repeating more or less the same menu everyday.  All meals are buffets.  Overall a very pleasant experience.
title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

review: After a volunteer build in the northern part of Kenya (Bungoma Region), our group of 10 volunteers plus our 2 drivers spent two nights at this gorgeous hotel in November. The rooms were fantasic, each tent is essentially in its own nook of the grounds, with a view of either some vegetation or a small river, with very comfortable, large beds, plenty of storage for unpacking your suitcases, and a very elegantly designed bathroom, especially considering the walls are essentially tents. We went on 4 safaris while we we stayed there, and got to see all of Kenya's big five animals! We even saw a cheetah and her cub minutes after she killed an impala, so her cub could eat. Overall, my experience at this hotel could not have been made any better. I would be very reluctant to stay
title: An oasis in the middle of the Maasai Mara

review: If you have not stayed at a Sarova owned hotel before then you have not experienced life! I have lived and traveled in Kenya for over 18 years and have never in my life enjoyed staying in any location (worldwide) as much as I enjoy their hotels. The Sarova Mara Game Camp has exceptional personnel working there, and you cannot leave the camp without feeling refreshed and rested. Hats off to Francis the manager, Caroline the Guest Relations Director, Caroline the Restaurant Director, Marcos who runs the clinic, and Grace who takes care of all my clients in the Tulia Massage area!  I can promise you there is not better service in ANY hotel you will ever stay at! The have set a very high standard for all the rest!
title: Best in Mara

review: The camp was a relaxing, luxurious place to return to after game drives. The food (all-you-can-eat buffet style) was spectacular; one night we were there was African night, with costumed waiters & a traditional Swahili menu. Note that guests do have to pay for all drinks at meals, including bottled water. The rooms/tents were spacious and clean with an attention to little details that made our stay more comfortable. The facilities were well-maintained and the spa massages were a great value! Our one complaint about our stay was the lack of mosquito netting in the tents. There was a mossi chip heater thing instead, which plugged into the wall & generally did a good job of keeping mosquitoes away. However, the camp was run on generator power, which was shut off between midnight &
title: Felt like a movie
Great location, amazing game drives, Balloon Safari, etc....

review: Hot water bags were provided in our bed for heating the bed. Not much activities to do so it was a kinda boring when you are back from the Game Drives. Even though they provided Torch in the room; Lighting outside tents were not adequate at night. We could can hear our neighbors at night and noise from pedestrian traffic and trolleys was a irritable at times; especially in the mornings. Food is served in buffet style. coffe, tea and cookies / cake where kept near the restaurant and was helpful while and going and coming from game drives.  lunch boxes were provided for those who go for drives at the meal timings. The Masai Mara is beautiful and lots of game to see....
title: Great Lodge & Service!

review: We stayed  in a Club Tent (highest category) for 3 nights and really loved the lodge alot. The tents were luxurious and big, with desk and lounge chair, safe, hairdryer, lots of room to put your clothes and a very nice and big bathroom with 2 sinks and all amenities (no outdoor showers unfortunately). The tents are under a wooden roof and very tightly secured, so in case of rain or wind there is no flapping etc. (We noticed this as a slight nuisance in another camp later on our trip, where with some wind the tent starting making funny noises throughout the night). Although the lodge is quite big with about 75 tents, hence a maximum of 150 people, it still gives you the impression of quiet and nicely set in a lush green scenery with a little lake even. We did notice that some of
title: Disaster from start to finish

review: This was a great place to stay in the Masai Mara.  The tents were really superb, such a unique experience.  It felt really clean and well kept.  We had a smaller tent (#27) which we loved and when we saw the larger ones, were actually quite happy we had the small one as it felt more like a tent rather than a room!  Agree with previous reco, try to have a higher # to get further from people/the bar.  We were not bothered, despite being very close to everything. The food was good, the meat was definitely the best part, it was great.  We also enjoyed the fresh chapatis and naan bread.  The desserts were not good, I stuck with fruit. We were told there would be a full breakfast available on the morning when we left early for the safari (6:20 and we wanted to bring a little snack)
title: Loved the tents!

review: Expansive hotel, where rooms are arranged in very confortable 'tents' with fully functioning bathrooms including hot-water showers --  greatly appreciated after a dusty safari run.  The staff were really attentive.  Aside from an isolated incident with the greeter at the restaurant, the rest of the staff was special.    The Spa lady needs to be commended.    You can tell this hotel has been around for a while, very organized, grounds lushly landscapped.    Even then though, it does not nor feel tired/worn nor Disney-safari like.  I was afraid of the quality of the food given that this hotel tends to cater groups or people on set tours.   All in all, while not 5* I was pleasantly surprised about both the variety and quality of it all.   They always had local Kenyan dishes to try
title: Beyond all our expectations. Will go back very soon.

review: This was the most exiting destination for us for several reasons. The service by all the staff from the most junior to the most senior was uniform in being of very high class and it was clear that agreat deal of time and effort has been put in ensuring that ALL the staff work in perfect harmony! I cannot remember a time when I have been to a hotel and left with such a high impression. The waiters seemed to have been trained to anticipate all our needs and seemed to be present and attentive at all times. I heard several other guests make similar comments. Words do not begin to describe the meeting point between luxury and the rugged  "bush" This is the place for those acustomed to luxury, as the rooms testify.
title: TOP CLASS STAY,excellent stay yet again,will be back

review: Just got back from a 5 day African safari.  Stayed at the Sarova chain of hotels in Nairobi, Lake Nakuru and Masai Mara.  Worth every penny!!  The Mara Game Camp facility was wonderful - out in the middle of Masai Mara Reserve but doesn't feel like you are roughing it.  We had a family tent which was more than enough space for two adults, two kids.  Everything was clean and comfortable.  The food was fantastic (always something for everyone, especially picky kids).  The staff was so friendly and helpful, made you feel right at home.  Pool was a little cold for April but it didn't stop my kids from swimming.  The games drives were simply amazing.  Top notch all the way around.  The only thing that I would warn is the drive to the camp is very rough (remember this is a huge
title: Most Amazing Holiday
Don't forget to talk to Masai pool man Joseph!  Unbelievable Luxury Tents and Food

review: We just came back from Kenya and this was probably our favorite hotel of the 6 in which we stayed.  All of the Sarovas are fantastic (their fresh, gourmet food, service, and accomodations are on par with a Four Seasons).   We stayed in a Club Tent so this review is based on that.  This "tent" had hardwood floors, french doors, a sitting area, desk, a safe, HUGE bathrooom with granite floors and counter tops and 2 sinks.  The bed was a huge, California king with amazing linens.  The room was big enough to fit an additional bed for our son and still have plenty of space.  It was really over-the-top.  The porch was gorgeous and very private, and we even saw a giraffe one morning just on the other side of the fence.   We wish we could have stayed longer.  Our package that we were on
title: Not worth it, humid, not well maintained, no view

review: The tents are very humid as they are in the forest.  The maintenance of the place is not good: holes in the napkins! At that rate you do not expect such. They were some work going on when we stayed there: you do not really enjoy having a nap with the noise of a sledgehammer! Incredible! Staff is friendly but too busy, you have to chase them to get a drink.  We were welcomed by the security guard, this is not really welcoming for a relaxing stay.  The food is a cheap buffet, uncooked vegetables, bad taste.  The guides taking us for game drives were all excellent, friendly and knowledgeable.  In short, this is a place to avoid. At the same rate or with a small difference, you can stay at the Serena!
title: A must

review: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon this summer and couldn't have asked for more from a tented lodge. We stayed in one of the higher spec tents and it had quite literally everything we wanted. The room was clean and comfortable and had all the amenities we could have wanted.  The staff were friendly and approachable and the restaurant laid on a buffet every day. The pool was clean (if not a little cold!) but was a good place to relax after a morning game drive.  Having been to Kenya twice before, and stayed in different lodges, would definitely stay here again. Only minor complaint is that the hotel is quite big and there are always a lot of people about, but this is just a tribute to its quality!
title: Would definitely go back to this hotel

review: From The Bull to The Buffalo Part 5  Masa Mara Sarova Mara Lodge 24 to 26 Sept 2010  The journey was fascinating from Lake Nakuru to the Mara. We stopped for our boat trip to see Hippo and birds. Then to purchase copper coloured Kenyan tea and rich flavoured ground Kenyan coffee.  Perhaps the most Kenyan feature were miles of brand new tarmac road covered in boulders and thorn bushes while we negotiated craters and mud ridges. Why? Government or local authority  forgotten to pay the contractor? No dash in the godfather’s back pocket? Are there really so many tourists happily enduring the back jarring Safari Van ride who will come again that the Kenyan authorities can afford to ignore their comfort? How much extra do lorry repairs add to food bills?  Eventually we reached Serena
title: The Best Safari Lodge, shame the last game drive did not match.

review: I travelled here with my parents and brother, and had a truly great experience. We stayed in the club tents which are comfortable, spacious and extremely clean. The bathroom part of the tent is a proper bathroom, with brick walls and wooden doors, which I much prefer to tent bathrooms.  The club tents are right at the border of the property, which itself is in the middle of the Masai Mara, so you can hear the animals at night, and wake up to dik-diks right at the verandah! At night we could see the buffalos walking right beyond the fence. It could be scary, but the property is properly fenced , and they have gaurds patrolling all night. The hotel is beautiful, we had a 5 minute walk to the main lobby and restaurant from the tent, which is lovely, accross a little bridge, and
title: Terrific Tented Camp for the Size
Great way to see the Mara

review: I stayed here with my girlfriend and her parents in March for four days. Overall, we had an extremely great time. The hotel is clean and comfortable, the tented rooms very homey - somewhat luxurious but still feel kind of rustic. The lounge/bar area was great, and they had a wonderful guitar player singing every night. The pool area was lovely as well, with a bar that was always stocked to keep your day drunk going. The food ranged from poor to very good, with most of it being solidly in the middle, though there was always enough variety to ensure there is something you will like.   We booked directly with the hotel, and so we had a hotel driver, who was fantastic. As a result, we were in one of the great Sarova SUVs - by far the best and most comfortable vehicles we saw out
title: Very good - not quite great

review: Pros - Beautiful scenery and landscape - Right at the tip of Masai Mara, which is at the heart of the annual animal migration - Beautifully appointed tents but with all the comforts of an indoor hotel room - Very comfortable bed with hot water warmers placed during turndown - Great housekeeping and turndown service - Food at restaurants were delicious and the buffet spread was comprehensive - I highly recommend the bush dinner where a buffet dinner is served in the middle of nowhere, under the stars, next to the bonfire after a traditional performance.. it was such an out-of-the-world experience - Cold towels and orange juice on arrival  Con - No direct line to reception at all  - Some rooms may find the trek to reception/drop off quite far - (both pro and con), but electricity
title: Our most memorable Holiday
We definitely will arrange another holiday.

review: If you are in Masai mara national reserve, this game camp is a Must. The place is just wonderfull, the staff very profesional and helpfull and very friendly. I had met stanley at Lion Hill Lodge the previous year and I saw him this year at Sarova Mara Game Camp and he has way to just make you feel welcomed and important.  The food was very good! The tent were spectacular. Peaceful and joyfull. My friend and clients that i have recommended  even rate this Camp as Very classic.   The evening entertainment was relaxing.  The lodge is also situated at strategic location for game viewing, saw all the big five. Thumbs up and 5 start from me and my wife!
title: Nice and comfortable hotel

review: This was the 3rd Sarova hotel we stayed in on our honeymoon. It is in a fantastic location and we personally thought that the food selection was excellent!  We were treated really well by the staff, I couldnt fault the service. We were even lucky enough to have our own private candle lit meal which was organised between our travel agent and the hotel which just made our trip!  The only disappointment, which I suppose cant be helped, is that the hotel feels very vast and very "tourist" which took away the magic a bit. It was very busy and our personal tent was not as luxurious as we had hoped. But that is us being very picky.  We found the Sarova chain to be the best hotels in Kenya and would reccommend them to anyone, and the safaris in the Masai are second to none!
title: Very nice but not "wow"

review: We arrived 26 Aug 2011 We stayed in tented lodges which was amazing away from everyone else quiet peaceful four poster bed over looking the masai mara we could see the animals grazing from our verandah.  This is my 3rd time to the Mara, and the best lodge I have stayed in, it is situated in the mara and not the outskirts which is where we stayed before. Food good. and we saw the big five in one game drive, and lovely leopard up a tree, and three cheatahs also a black rhino. Cheatah and blk rhino I have never seen before, in my previous visits so for me it was a magical time. Also the best time to go, because of the amount of game in the area ie. Wilderbeasts thousands and thousands of them, every were you look. We had an amazing time thanks to Virgin who use Rhino Safaries also
title: excellent position in the Mara
Excellent camp! Guide changed every day.

review: We stayed in Mara Sarova Camp for three nights during end of July 2011. It was a great trip from airport till we were dropped off at airport. Excellent tents,beds and very good food. It was crowded as it was during Great Migration time. We could see all the big five plus river crossing thanks to excellent tour guide Ken Kisio whose knowledge of park,animals have enriched us. We could in fact take excellent video of  wild beast crossing and a kill by a lion at close range. Our only  disappointment was we could not have the same guide assigned for all three days which caused lot of anguish as every guide is not as knowledgeable and understand the need of the travelers.
title: Fab furry final fling

review: We finished our 9-day Kenyan safari on a high with 3 nights at this 'camp'.  My wife adored it.  It's more a resort with stand-alone, tent-like cabins than a camp. I preferred the 3 star Amboseli camp which started our safari because it was more authentic.  But even I can't deny this place is very impressive.   Our 'tent' was about four times the size of its Amboseli counterpart, which would have fitted in this one's ensuite!  I say 'tent' because, although the bedroom walls and ceiling are made of canvas, they hang from a permanent roof.  While the ensuite is entirely permanent and attaches seamlessly to the bedroom.  But I'm quibbling; happy wife, happy life.  And I enjoyed the luxury, too. I hasten to add that 'tents' come in two sizes and we had one of the large ones.  It
title: Wonderful accomodation

review: Amazing. From start to finish this place is brilliant. The bumpy drive to the lodge of about 2 hours is worth it. We had 3 game drives from here and saw all of the big 5. leopards, lions (and cubs), cheetah, elephant, giraff, wilderbeast, and countless gazelles and antelope. The tents are canvas tents with a brick built ensuite bathroom attached. The tents have full electric and are very comfortable, wooden floors and a proper bed. This is camping, but in full luxury! Would return to this lodge again. the food is buffet style and can be cold if left, but they do have hot versions still on the stove, and will give you hot if you ask. fantatsic choice and very chilled out surroundings. Nice bar and wood fire in the evenings, but most people go staright to sleep after dinner, as
title: Right in the masi Mara

review: well you must be in a comfortable 4*4 to enjoy the mara an should have the first game drive i loved the 6am game drive
title: Just ok

review: No views from property. Tented rooms are ok. Buffet food was average - nothing great. Seemed crowded/busy. There are much nicer places to stay on the Masai Mara.
title: What an amazing experience!

review: A truly luxurious tent. What a bed, the bathroom and the cleanliness! WOW! Felt like the king of the jungle :) Feels like a tent pitched in the wilderness but with all the luxuries you can ask for. The buffet spread was such a treat. The little souvenir shop added to the charm of the place. The bar was great and be sure that the singer will sing "Hakunamatata" There are little deers running around the hotel.....i would strongly recommend Sarova Mara game camp to anyone who wants to make their safari holiday a memorable one
title: Hospitality @ it`s best

review: Wonderful lodge and awesome experience in the Masai Mara. The lodge is well situated within the National Park for a quick flight in from Nairobi. Enroute from the airstrip to the lodge we saw huge herds of elephant, buffalo, a leopard sleeping in a tree and lions, 4 of the big 5 and we hadn't even started our game drives yet.  The staff were all exceptionally friendly, the tented lodging was extremely luxurious and the buffet meals were amazing & an extensive wine list - what more could you ask for? A Spa with a great selection of treatments and Grace is a great masseuse so was forced to have a massage daily. what an awesome, relaxing 5 days!! I can't wait to go back.
title: Wonderful lodge in Masai Mara

review: We found this to be an excellent location, Good food,relaxed and comfortable.  With more trees in the Eastern end of the the Masai Mara we saw Leopard every day, Rhino daily, lots of cats- lion families of up to 14, 3 cheetah together and a lot of other animals. The Camp is away from the Mara River for the Wildebeest crossing but the Game viewing on the way was fantastic. Balloon flights give you a totally different perspective of the Wildebeest trails, warthog holes and animals.
title: Mara Sarova Game Camp

review: My friend and I stayed 2 nights in the Sarova Mara Camp and was well worth the 80km drive along a bumpy road from the nearest town (the road is being repaired/ improved......). Our tent was quite luxurious compared to what we were expecting, and had all the mod cons such as toilet and shower! it was lovely to be able to hear all the birds singing etc The hotel itself was good, as was the restaurant. The staff were always attentive and really friendly. The location's great, as no sooner we were out of the gate and in the reserve we were soon animal spotting! I'd definitely recommend this hotel
title: Great tent!

review: If you are looking to experience the real safari the Sarova Mara Tented Camp is the place to go... My second trip to Africa, this time to visit the beautiful parks and feel the real safari way of life, I've stayed in MARA TENTED CAMP 2 nights, see a lot of people arriving/leaving and all staff always ready to assist and smiling. The food is rich and diverse, all the facilities are clean and cousy, ours was nothing luxury, but that's the magic of the safari! Is a quiet camp, you have many places to rest and enjoy wildlife, example dik-dik (I think) running next to you, playing with each other! The expectations were high but they were fulfilled, didn't miss anything. Next time I will choose SAROVA MARA TENTED CAMP... Ahsante Sana to all team... You made us a very happy couple!
title: The real deal

review: We were a little apprehensive about staying at our first tented lodge, but this was 'four seasons' camping.  The 'tent' had all the amenities, including plumbing, was located in a paradise of wildlife away from the main area of the camp.  The service and food were excellent.  I'd recommend to anyone, and don't be put of by 'tent', this is luxurious
title: Beyond Camping

review: The tents were outstandingly convenient! Loved the bathroom. The sit out overlooking the mara savannah gave a great feeling.....especially when watching he returning animals at sunset! The property has large open spaces and located conveniently close to the centre of the park. Good food and great staff.
title: Wonderful property

review: Me, my husband and 4 kids stayed at the Sarova Tented Camp for a 2 night/ 3 day safari. First time camping like this! Hot water, lovely showers in each tent. What a fantastic time we had. The tour was organised by Silverbird Adventure Tours. Nothing was a problem for them, they organised it all and our driver (Stanley, who was wonderful) met us at our Nairobi hotel in the morning of our safari and drove us through the Rift Valley to Sarova Tented Camp. It didn't disappoint, our tent was lovely. We had 3 to a tent, abit cramped but not a problem at all. Food at the hotel was buffet style and there was a wide variety to suit everyone, lovely too. Our driver stayed on site and took us out every morning early and every afternoon on safari. The location was so good that we got to see
title: Great Location - what an experience for the family!

review: great food, superb sleep, very very clean. We stayed in a tented camp close to the lake and it was awesome.....a pygmy deer wandered into our tent and even hid under our backpaks....The lookout deck is good too. very peaceful and scenic.The food is a vast and  sumptitious spread...utterly delicious is the bacon...i've never had it sweeter. The staff are very helpful and even packed up the remains of my breakfast plus some stuff more to munch when we realised we may be running a bit late. Very highly recommended !!!!
title: This is THE PLACE to stay !!!Excellent !!!!

review: This was my second visit to the beautiful Masai Mara. Mara Sarova is situated close to the park entrance and not too far from the Masai village. This proximity to "human activity" however did not affect out game drives. We saw the big five on our first 2 game drives!!   The resort appears remodeled with new fixtures and amenities. The staff went out of their way to be hospitable and helpful. We had a server in the restaurant who made a special tea for us every day! The food, meat and vegetarian, was truly outstanding. There was a wide variety of vegetarian food including many indian curries which we really enjoyed.   The rooms are small but they are adequate and still feel luxurious. The only problem we had were ants in the bathroom on our 2nd night. We had plenty of hot water..
title: Fantastic resort!! Ideal location, amazing food for vegetarians

review: Another animal planet, beautiful animals, awesome service, lovely and adorable Masais all over.. Early and evening game drives can get you seeing the big five in one day.. The drive is a bit rough but the powers that be are working on repairing the road.. 4 hour drive from Nairobi and you are in another planet; full of wild animals and great food and service at Sarova..
title: Pleasant Surprise

review: we stayed there for 2 nights and we were realy lucky, we saw the big five. We went there by Bus, but i would recommend to fly in, the drive is long and the call it also a bush massage. The food in the lodge was excellent, served as buffet. There is also a small pool area. From midnight to 4 o'clock they switch off the electical power, after you know how dark night can be. But you have flashlights in every tend and also candles. Would go again anytime. We were lucky also the lodge was not full so it was very quite, specialy the first night.
title: loveley loadge, very nice people
Great experience - love the club tent!

review: We stayed 2 nights here as part of a tour we booked through Lion World Tours in Toronto.  The trip was outsourced to a local company, LIberty, which did an excellent job and our guide Samson was amazing.  The last place we stayed on the 8 day journey with LIberty was at the Sarova Mara Tented Camp.  Prior to this, we had stayed at the Sarova Lion Hill and Sarova Shaba.  By far, this was the most luxurious and beautiful of all.  Food at all resorts were very similar in terms of selection and quality - all good.  Food had a great mix of international, a very modest amount of local type food and Indian cuisine.  We were always satisfied and our favorite meal was breakfast (the pancakes are so yummy).  About the tents:they have family sized tents, standard tents and superior (or
title: Nice Hotel despite initial problems

review: Booked complete flight, hotel and game drive package directly with Mara Sarova for October 2011.  Picked up by Mara Sarova game drive from the Keekrok strip and the first game drive was excellent. We had our own car / driver the whole 2 day safari trip between 3 of us so that was great as we learnt loads on the trip. Excellent location in Masai Mara.  We went to the hotel and checked in and booked a triple room. We were given a small standard room with an extra pull out bed and were told this was adequate but we could not even walk from one end of the room to the other - even the hotel staff were unable to do so. We couldn't even walk to the bathroom through the beds which is absolutely ridiculous. We went to complain to the manager (it took them a long time to get her even
title: Wonderful stay @ mara sarova

review: While planning my trip to Masai Mara with my wife, my efforts on a google search rendered several options but based on the suggestion of  a friend in Nairobi,I am glad that we chose Sarova Mara Game Camp for our 3 days-2 nites safari stay. The place is just so amazing in the middle of vast lands of Masai Mara.  A grand entry point where you are greeted well and then taken to a lounge for check -in formalities. Post the formalities , we were taken to our tent......and it was a tent only  by the outside look. Beautifully done luxurious interiors really refreshed both of us though we had a long journey from Nairobi. The tent had all the amenities which a 5-star hotel can boast of......cozy bed, dressing table, space for keeping luggage, a locker and a walled bathroom as well. The
title: Best possible tented stay in Masai Mara

review: We just got back from a trip to Kenya and we stayed at the camp for two nights. I wish we could have stayed longer. Our experience was lovely. The whole property is beautiful but the Club Level Tents are AMAZING! Hardwood floors, canopy beds and wonderful bathrooms in your tent. Loved it!
title: Awesome Experience

review: This is a extremely relaxing and pleasant place to stay. Even without the game park surrounding it, it would have been a good place for relaxing a couple of days. The tents are spread over a large area so even if it is quite big you never feel very close to other guests.  I am not a big fan of pool-and-buffet kind of places but in this small scale and with the warm, welcoming African service, I felt really at peace here.
title: Would have been a great place even without the game park

review: I stayed at the game camp for 2 nights and it was worth every penny. The staff is so polite and the location is just amazing to sit back and relax. Located in Masai Mara,you will always hear the sound of nature,from crickets,birds,monkeys,etc. Infact you will also spot a few dig digs(miniature sized gazelles) grazing within the camp,which is just so nice to look at. Being an indian,i had no problems with food as the buffet for BLD ws served with all kinds of vegetarian indian food. They have a show or dance every night depicting the dances of the masai tribe,which is very entertaining The rooms are good,equipped with nets,and fully functional attached bathrooms. So after a long day after your game drive,u can rest comfortably.
title: A camp on heaven

review: Sarova Mara is at a very good location for gaming. We could spot all the big five at a very short distance from the hotel.The food quality and variety is excellent.Staff are courteous and helpful. Now , there are no views from the tent if thats what one is looking for. Hot water bag inside the bed kept us warm.We stayed for 2 nights and it is a good place to stay and enjoy the gaming.There are no fear of monkeys at all!!!
title: Superb location for gaming

review: The tents were amazing and extremely luxurious. The staff were all friendly and helpful and you could see that they were very passionate about their roles at the camp. They went out of their way to organise little competitions such as omlette making and cocktail making, which I thought was a fantastic way to get guests to interact with other. Evening entertainment was plentiful. Food was fantastic and the staff happily fulfilled my request for a small birthday cake and sing along.  Would happily recommend
title: Honeymoon at the Sarova Mara

review: I had  a wonderful and memorable experience in the wild Mara for our honeymoon. We chose to have wonderful time in the wild so we booked Mara Sopa and Mara Sarova. I must say my wife and I really enjoyed the food and the hospitality of the staff. We stayed in Tent 63 which is on the edge. Almost next to the fence.It was quiet peaceful and relaxing.  The rooms were very clean and this made us enjoy our stay.The sound of birds,cricket,and other animals was soothing and a little scary especially for the wild animals.  Our experience one night as we were heading for dinner, we had some motion in the bushes as we were scared to "death". We asked for security escort to our room only to meet Topi.  Mara Sopa hyena feeding experience was exciting experience.
title: Absolute Heaven

review: After having spent two weeks working on building projects in central Kenya, I was ready for a bath and some good food. The Sarova Mara far exceeded any expectations that I had about 'tent' camps. Upon arrival, we were greeted and taken directly to the outstanding lunch buffet while our bags were transported to our tents. The food, the scenary, the grounds and the accomodations are all superb; the Sarova might be the best place I have ever stayed, since I normally travel on a tight budget. While we paid a resonable price for our 3 nights stay, the Sarova is anything but budget.  Not only is the food exquisite and the atmosphere divine, but the poolside relaxation was heaven-sent.
title: Amazing experience!

review: At first I doubted that I would enjoy the tent - not big fan of camping, but the stay at Sarova Mara has nothing to do with real camping. The tents are spacious and the bed very comfortable, covered with mosquito net. The bathroom attached to the tent was just like any  bathroom you expect to find in a hotel - clean, with enough hot water and light.   It was so nice sitting outside the tent during the day and looking at the small animals, which came from time to time from the forest around.   The food was excellent! The people are very friendly. It is a big camp, but did not feel overcrowded at all. The location is great and you drive only a couple of minutes before you get to the real savannah.
title: Fantastic place

review: This is one of the best tented camps in maasai mara with superb luxury tents and nice and humble service. I really enjoyed the place and the facilities, thanks alot Collins Bush finders.
title: AMONG THE BEST TENTED CAMPS IN MARA.

review: I was the tour leader for singlestravelcompany.com, located in San Jose, California and my group of 16 and myself stayed here for two nights. A great variety of choices for lunches and dinners and everything was prepared nicely and was plentiful and tasty. Our tented homes were lovely with modern facilities. What really made our trip so special was the wonderful guest relations manager, Caroline, who went beyond the call of duty. She opened up the internet two hours earlier than normal and came in on her day off so we all would have our  boarding passes for our trip back to the U.S. She always was there to greet us and make sure everything was fine with our group.   I definately would recommend staying here as it was a pleasant experience for our group and myself.
title: Great hospitality and lovely accommodations

review: Stayed 2 nights and everything exceeded my expectations.   Great food, a wonderful "room" which are really tents.  When I heard the word tents I didn't know what I would find, but now I know they are very comfortable.  Nice bathrooms and hot showers.  No complaints at all.
title: Awesome experience

review: We recently stayed here for 3 evenings whilst on safari in the Maasai Mara. We were really happy our tent ... it was down a secluded path near a stream and was beautifully decorated. Every morning and evening the staff would open/close the window blinds and mosquito nets which was a lovely touch. We appreciated the hot water bottle in the bed to ease the cold chill in the evenings. Our tent had a safe which was very easy to use. The food was all buffet style with a massive selection on offer for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The staff were attentive ... the chefs were happy to cook meat to order or make mixed salads with oils etc. There was a selection of Western and African dishes to choose from and you could choose to sit indoors or on the balcony. The safari tours were
title: A+ accommodation in the Maasai Mara!

review: I think the current term is GLAMPING!  You are under canvas but in style!  Hearing the Masai Mara noises at night is just amazing, but be assured you will sleep due to the comfort of the accommodation.  The pool area, bar and restaurant are beautiful and of a very high standard.  Unfortunately I wasn't very well when there, but can assure you that should you ever find yourself in that unfortunate position, the on-site medical staff are fantastic and had me back on my feet in hours.  I cannot thank them enough as this meant that I missed nothing.  You are right in the Masai Mara, which provided me with sightings of 4 of the Big 5, a leopard up a tree eating it's kill being one highlight!!  A real experience!
title: Amazing!

review: We were a couple looking for a safari adventure but also a nice relaxing stay. This place was brilliant. It was reasonable in terms of price, as these luxury tents/lodges do get expensive.  We stayed in tent 21, it had a comfy bed, nice hot shower, and wooden floors. they even brought us hot water bottles at night.  We used the game drives from here, our driver william, was excellent. we saw everything. we even had a cheetah jump on the land-cruiser (apparently it is familiar with the car) The food in this place is amazing, an array of dishes, courses and styles to choose from.  The pool was nice and relaxing.  If i was being super harsh, then this place doesn't have a hippo bar to chill out by and there wasnt a huge amount to do in the evenings.
title: Excellent retreat, super staff and relaxed atmosphere

review: I have stayed there for two nights this week. My Camp number was 68. I would recommend it to everybody. It as amaizing.I have stayed in many hotels in many different places but it really impressed me. Standard was like in best hotels. Staff great and helpfull, food great but the most amaizing were atmosphere and incredable views. Location is in Masai Mara, green everywhere, monkeys on the trees and a lots of other animals. After Safari it is the best place to take a rest and relax - just sit in the forrest and admire nature!!!
title: Great lodge in the Masai Mara

review: I recently visited the camp with my friend and her two year  old daughter. The tents are really nice but ours didn't have a nice view so a bit disappointing in that respect. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially with the little one. Food was good too. The camp is set in a nice jungly area which I normally would have appreciated very much but because of that you didn't get the feeling that you were actually in the Maasai Mara... Could have been anywhere. We went to a different lodge the next day with fabulous views onto the Mara. So we did enjoy the camp but not for the views.
title: Great place

review: I stayed hear for 2 nights and loved this hotel. The tent-style rooms make you feel like you are camping out in the bush and makes the whole trip seem more authentic. The food was great (buffet) and the grounds were very large so you could go for a stroll after lunch before setting off for your evening safari.  Although the camp is surrounded by electric fence, it was a little scary to think that a leopard could jump over the fence using the trees!!! But in reality that was not going to happen.  Overall I highly recommend this beautiful hotel/camp.
title: Great hotel, great food

review: The Sarova Mara Game Camp is just amazing. It is ideally located 3km away from the Masai Mara Reserve main gate.  We really enjoyed our 2-night stay in March 2012.  The front desk staff is efficient and dedicated. The tents are truly nice and well organised with bathroom of fair size. Restaurant is of good quality (in fact exactly the same food as at any Sarova hotel, 2 choices of meat dish + 1 choice of fish dish). Service is perfect. Swimming pool is nice, there is a putting green, a fish pond (kids are actually fishing). It is worth visiting the organic vegetable garden,  But the strong advantage of the camp is that we can walk witin the compound perimeter and look at wildlife beyond the electrical barriers. After walking through the BOMA (turn right just after tents 50-51),
title: Our favourite hotel in Kenya

review: I stayed at Sarova Camp for 2 nights in early March. They were 2 memorable nights that I'll never forget. First, the game drive, which is the most important part of any safari traveller, was spectacular. Sarova provides proper land cruisers so u can get the full experience and view. The guide was extremely friendly and very helpful and had a lot of info to share. As for the camp, it was just great. The tents are beautiful and comfortable with clean private bathrooms and all. You can get some monkey visitors around ur tent so don't be alarmed :) the food's also great! The best thing for sure is the extremely friendly staff! Overall it was an amazing experience and u recommend Sarova to everyone!
title: Great accomodation, food and sensation of wildness

review: I have no words to describe this great hotel (camp)! The staff was very kind and useful, the accomodation in the tent is the experience that you must tu try and the food was excellent!
title: Just loved it!

review: We had a wonderful stay at this lodge.  We arrived to a welcome glass of juice and an efficient check-in.  We were then taken to our Club Tent.  We were so glad we spent the extra money for the upgrade--it was huge and nicely decorated and way on the edge of the lodge, very isolated and looking out over the fence into the park.  It felt like an incredibly beautiful and private retreat.  The facilities are also great.  Don't be fooled by the tent idea-we had all amenities.  I loved the porch for reading.  We had a big bed surrounded by mosquito netting--staff would place a hot water bottle under the covers at night.  We also had a huge bathroom with two sinks, plenty of space to spread out, and lots of nice toiletries--loofah, sewing kit, shoe mitts, etc.  We loved sitting with a
title: Just like a dream!

review: Had a fly in safari at Sarova Mara Camp for 2 nights March 24-25, 2012 and had one of the best safari experiences in Kenya (out of 6).  Was upgraded to a club tent - wonderful luxury tent with every need provided - hair dryer, slippers, house coat, shaving & toothbrush package, etc.  Had a great view of the savannah with african buffalo right oustside (with an electric fence between me and them).  My only tent criticism is that the bed mattress was very hard (woke with a sore back).  The game drive in a refitted landcruiser was great.  Driver/guide Edward was superb.  We found the big five including 2 leopards feasting on their kill and 11 lions gorging on a kill of four buffalo, plus the rhino (after a long search).  The food was excellent.  Fresh vegetable and fruit salads
title: Sarova Mara Camp is excellent!

review: This was the final destination for our week and what I thought would be the grand finale was just kind of a ho hum finish.  Don't get me wrong, the park is beautiful (although I think it is better suited for trips during the migration - we had very long drives with minimal close animal sightings).  Nakuru, Amboseli, Tsavo each had greater animal sightings without the endless driving on pretty bad roads. I also think staying in a club tent would be a game changer as well (we stayed in the regular tent) but saw the nicer tents on a walk around the property.  I am 6'2" and couldn't stand up in our tent (which wasn't my experience in a similar tent at Tsavo).  One nice touch that the other places didn't have was a candle in the room.  It makes for a nice setting at night (better
title: Luxury and Service redefined

review: We spent three days and two nights at the Sarova Mara and enjoyed every bit of it. Firstly, they upgraded us to a club tent (#62) which was amongst the farthest tents and afforded us the privacy that we wanted. The so called tent was simply out of this world. If this is what constitutes a "Camp", then sign me up for camping any day. With wooden floors, luxurious beds, a swanky washroom/sink area and an awesome patio, there was nothing that could be counted as anything less than immaculate. The entire tent was tastefully decorated and had utilities such as a safe locker, adapters and candles. Just when you thought you are staying in a five star resort in the middle of the savannahs, the staff makes it even better. Even by Asian standards, where the service industry is notches
title: The Best Safari Lodge ever!

review: This place was great! The tents were perfect. I could have stayed here longer. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. You really feel like you're in nature.
title: Great rooms...

review: Brilliant hotel... stayed in the club tent which was absolutely amazing  Food is good .. nice swimming pool and very friendly staff :)  Would recommend to anyone ..
title: Mara Sarova

review: A series of "wows".  Wow, the tents were our favorite accommodation on our week long trip, both for the kids (age 11 and 13 year old American girls)  and the tired parents.  Great beds, new mosquito nets, immaculately clean, hot shower, plush towels.  Wow, the front desk staff was friendly ( All Kenyans seem to be...) and very helpful.  Caroline and Koi made our stay personal and even more inviting, teaching the kids Masai games and card tricks, too.  Wow, the pool was gorgeous, a real oasis, and relaxing.  Wow, the internet connection was fast and reliable, and when I had trouble signing on in the beginning, Caroline worked it out.  Wow, food was abundant and tasty, plenty of options for picky eaters, too.  Wow, NO baboons to fret over!  But plenty of other animals to charm the
title: Very Friendly staff, Tents were great, Kids and parents all loved this property
Really nice pool; Way too many mosquitoes

review: My family and I are Americans who have been living and working in Kenya for 4 years; we've been to a few game parks and lodges.  Sarova is a great idea.  It's in a nice location, has pretty good (though not spectacular) food, good and friendly service and an absolutely beautiful swimming pool! We stayed in family tents, so I can't speak for the other tents (the standard tent and the camp tent), I can only tell my experience of the family tents.  They are a great concept.  2 separate tents - one with a queen size or bigger bed, and the other with 2 twin or double beds - connected with a beautiful closed in wide veranda complete with table and chairs, couches and a beautiful view of the "jungle" behind the tents.  The only problem was that the weren't really closed in.  One was
title: Exceeded our expectation

review: A nice mixed shelter (tented with hard top roof and bathroom). The park is well maintained. We encountered only very helpful staff. Even a change of tents was taken care of without any problem. (It is a long walk to the tents at the edge of the park. If you are less mobile ask for a tent in the center). Afternoon drinks around the central fire or seated in soft clubs by the open stoves at the veranda. Tent service has a nice tough: a tablet incense on heated bamboo, a hot water bottle in the bed and of course closing the mosquito net and spraying. If one is used to visit the bathroom during the night, he should be aware of a power saving period between midnight and 04:00. Overall experience makes it worth recommending!
title: Exceeded expectations

review: The great attraction of this game lodge is just how close your tent is to the actual game. The tents themselves are magnificent. Hot water bottle in your bed while you are having dinner a nice touch. Food not as good as Lion Hill but everything else better.   Also.....not the hotels fault but having radios in all the jeeps is not good because as soon as a driver sees some game 30 jeeps arrive so you may as well be at the Zoo.
title: Out in the bush

review: We recently stayed 2 nights in the tented camp at Masai Mari May 5 & 6 2012. At the time of our visit the Mara was very wet & boggy because of late wet season rains. Game was still plentifull.The Sarova was very enjoyable and we found the meals and service to be more than acceptable. Our Safari was booked thru African Wildcats Adventure Safaris and they certainly delivered. Our Driver Steve was unbeatable in finding game and avoiding the treacherous bogs in the Mara during our visit.  We managed to have several fantastic days of game viewing prior to moving on to Tanzania and the Serengetti
title: MASAI MARA IN MAY 2012

review: The Sarova Mara Camp was everything I have dreamed of and more! From the start I felt perfectly welcomed.  Especially Geoffrey and Caroline in the reception were TERRIFIC! Friendly, personable and helpful they started my stay off perfectly with friendliness and a super great attitude!  The lodge was astonishing - super beautiful - and the tents felt absolutely Out of Africa! At night when I came to bed, I found bed warmers had been placed for me.  Super pretty - close to the entrance of the Mara - and simply the warmest welcome I've ever experienced. Great food - a wide and varied buffet with anything you could dream of!  Everyone I met was kind and positive and did their best to make my stay amazing. IF I were going on a Honeymoon again, this would be my choice!  I would get a
title: Best place I've ever been!

review: The tent accomodation was very comfortable and cosy.The food was good and fresh and i could get vegetarian indian food that was really a bonus for me.the tents are clean and well maintained and amazing variety in buffet lunch or dinner.The staff is very nice and friendly they made our trip really memorable.
title: great place

review: experience if they did not try to rip us off! Otherwise a wonderful property....  Positives?   - Excellent location (very near to park entrance) - Beautiful lush green property neatly tucked in to a small hill- completely hidden - Excellent service - Superb tents- Go for the club tents- they are located towards the edge of the premises. A long walk away from the reception but that's okay if you don't mind a nice walk. We could see elephants grazing across the fence from our tent. I did not see the standard tents from the inside but location wise they looked ordinary.  Negatives  - Strange insistence of staff on not allowing us to carry water bottles to the restaurant so that they can charge us a bomb for water bottles!!! Never experienced that one before. - Okay food.  Overall a
title: Could have been a better....

review: In November 2011 we went on a family trip to Kenya and spent a few days on safari.  We were very impressed with the accommodation - the staff were all very helpful and courteous and the common areas (including the pool) were very clean.  The food was delicious and there was a nice variety.  We had a few vegetarians in our group and they were very impressed that they had so many options.  The experience of sleeping in the tent and hearing all of the sounds at night is incredible.  The hot water bottles are a nice touch.  Before the morning drives they put out coffee, tea and light snacks.  Highly recommended.
title: Special place

review: We stayed at the Game Camp for three nights in October. From the first moment when we arrived and were met by Caroline with drinks to the last sad good bye we had a fantastic time and have many happy memories. All the facilities, tents, pool, food and public areas are wonderful, but it is the kind, cheerful and always engaging staff that really bring it all together....I happened to have a Birthday while we were there, the staff organised a candlelit dinner for our party in a private game viewing area, as a suprise, it made an already memorable stay even better! Thanks Savora Mara Game Camp!
title: Friendly staff, nice experience of living in a tent.

review: A great experience in tent - thats the highlight of this resort. It has got a big property with plenty of activities for kids; they enjoyed a lot - fishing, golf, archery, boating, lovely evening activities. The food and hospitality can be improved a bit; compared to Serena lodge at Amboseli National Park. The tent life is excellent and that exceeded our expectations....
title: A great experience

review: We had our wedding there in the middle of the migration season (September).  We booked a 4 day/3 night safari and there were 45 of us, mainly adults and a few kids and it was the best holiday I have ever had.  We had already been on safari twice to Masai Mara (as well as elsewhere in Kenya) and have travelled extensively around the world (although normally budget, rather than luxury), so I do not make that statement lightly.  Before we got there (a week in advance of the wedding), we had organised everything with the Sarova sales office via email.  The menu, the rooms, the type of vehicle we would safari in (BIG TIP - always book the land cruisers, they make for amazing game viewing and if you don’t you will regrettably look longingly at them from the 4x4 minibuses instead).  It
title: They exceeded all our expectations for our wedding day

review: they have beautiful tents the club tents are very luxurious family tents are good for families with children,the food is good they have entertainment in the evenings. overall a beautiful property.it is well located not very far from the main entry . the bar is very livly in the evenings they have lovely fire places.
title: It will blow you away!

review: You don't quite know what to expect in the middle of a game reserve and the first sight of the place will blow you away. But that's only the beginning as this place is going to exceed expectations at every step.  The warm welcome is typical of Kenya and as I got to know, the Sarova chain, wherever you are. We were upgraded to Club tent(s) which are majestic! The regular tents are zipped up in the front but these also have wooden doors! The large comfy bed, the wonderful decor and surprise, surprise, the large well appointed bathrooms with hot showers will impress you. We were given Club tents 70 & 71 which is a bit of a walk from the main recreation area. But these overlook the grassland and you don't see anybody else .. that's great!!  Food at the restaurant - very good
title: AWESOME!!!

review: We have been on about 8 safaris in a number of locations on the Massai Mara and once we found the Sarova Mara, we were hooked for good. We keep coming back and bringing our friends and they also are very impressed. It is very close to the Sekenani Gate so we are thankful to end our travel over the extreme roads as quickly as possible. We are greeted by exceptionally pleasant staff and ushered directly to the fabulous dining facilities. The lodging is superb and the food is excellent. We are always treated like royalty at the Sarova and the only bad part about staying there is when it is time to go home. This is a great location to launch out from on game drives and many animals abound in the area. We are already excited about coming back to Satova Mara.
title: Best Camp on the Mara

review: Stayed here by chance in May 2012.  I had originally planned to camp out myself in a tented SUV but decided to go for more traditional lodging instead.  This property consists of fully enclosed tent rooms with ensuite (private) bathrooms.  Bathroom was clean and well maintained.  Facilities are also clean, well kept and manicured.  Food quality and choices were great (Breakfasts and Dinners).  They offer great game drives and other tourist activities.  There is a wifi system although it wasn't working during my stay.    You also get to experience a little song and dance by the Maasai people.  This is another free little bonus that creates this atmosphere of fun and adventure.    WHY YOU WANT TO STAY HERE:  Two words..Caroline and Service.  Caroline is one of the managers of this
title: EXCELLENT Property, Staff, Service, Location, Experience, Ambiance!!
Best of all places we stayed in Kenya

review: First, pay the extra for a club tent.  It will be farther from the dining room but well worth it.  We stayed in lodges and regular tents for the rest of the trip but the club tent at Sarova was the highlight of the stay.  The bed was very comfortable, the food was great in both taste and variety, the rooms were clean and the grounds were stunning.  It was not all roses... They turn the power off from midnight until 4AM.  Hubby uses a CPAP machine at night which requires power.  As requested, they left the power on the first night but the second, they turned it off.  It is not too safe to walk around alone so hubby and I got dressed and went to the front desk. No one there.  There was a walkie talkie that we finally picked up and said we needed assist at the front desk.  Someone
title: Excellent location and accommodation
Best Game Reserve in Masai Mara

review: I can't think of a single negative point to share about the Sarova Mara Game Camp. I stayed there for two nights and wish I could have stayed a week. The camp and Masai Mara are incredible.
title: Experience of a lifetime. Hope I can go back someday soon.

review: After spending 10 nights in a bare bones retreat center with a lumpy pillow and food that was strictly nutrition, I and my compatriots were more than delighted to have two nights at Sarova Mara.  Luxury in the middle of the Maasai Mara, YAY!!  The tent cabins included well-appointed bathrooms with hot, hot showers, super comfy beds with soft sheets and great pillows.  The delight of the evening was the surprise of a hot water bottle warming my bed when I crawled in after a day of bone rattling drives across the Mara.  The dining room was a sight to behold; so many choices, food that was nicely presented and truly delicious.  And I can’t say enough about the staff; they were incredibly caring.  When Caroline found out there was a huge forest fire back home; she insisted I use the
title: Lions, Elephants, Comfy Bed, Hot Shower, Oh My
Hear the Roar in the night

review: Incredible experience in the Masai Mara, great tucker and well set out tents to listen to all the noises of the night in Kenya. Mozi nets were very appreciated plus safes. Only problem is I have to buy 150 cows to be able to experience polygamy instead of monotony.
title: luxury in the woods

review: this is a beautiful resort nestled in the masai  grasslands near from the entrance and very good hotel with excellent staying options club tents are luxurious and best the family tents are best choice for family with children,food is great to serve every pallete. game drives are beautiful and you can sometimes hear a lions roar in the night.
title: A nice oasis in the Masai Mara

review: We visited Sarova Mara as part of an organised trip through an agent, but found check-in wasn't as smooth as expected.  Basically our agent had made a late payment and although we had proof of payment from him, the hotel wasn't going to let us check in until the payment had cleared.  We spent a frustrating 3 hours trying to sort the problem out, which ended up with us having to pay for a night (having already paid a lot of money for the safari) and leaving us feeling really unhappy with the attitude of the hotel. However, leaving that aside, the Camp was lovely.  The accommodation is made up of tents under a solid structure, and the family tent was actually two tents within a wooden, roofed house, with a bathroom in the tent at the back.  Luxurious, apart from the resident bats
title: Not a good start ...

review: OMG I have died and gone to heaven! That honestly was my reaction when we arrived here. Thanks to my research on trip advisor when our trip was in the planning stage we upgraded to the club tents. They are a little further away from the main area but well worth the extra money. The club tents are in an area on their own and ours backed on to an electric fence where we were told that quite often a giraffe would wander past. The club tents are bigger than the standard tents and higher so my husband comfortably walked around inside. The king size bed was very comfortable. We also enjoyed a vino or 2 on our front deck. (We brought over a cask of red wine to enjoy on our safari and so pleased that we did). The laundry service was great it was quick and very reasonably priced. The
title: Amazing stay !

review: We visited this camp in July 2012 and had done the bookings basis the good reviews we read on trip advisor. We were not dissappointed with our choice, the camp was as good as it was described in the reviews. Unfortunately we couldnot book club tents and were awarded standard rooms. To our surprise, we found standard room more cosier thn the club rooms which were also far from the main reception and dining area. If I go back I might still stay in standard room, unless ofcourse you have kids and you need bigger tent area. The food was amazing with limited but good Indian dishes for both lunch and dinner.  The bar area is also decent and you have monkeys and dik diks outside your tents which makes you feel that you are very close to the nature.  Its a very nice property just near
title: Comfortable

review: Our tour was arranged by Geoffrey from www.untamedafricasafaris. He did a fabulous job, our safari was so well organised and planned. After the long and tedious ride to the Masai Mara, the Sarova Mara Game Camp is truly a treat for the eyes... the place is just fabulous... the staff are so nice and friendly, especially at the restuarant, the chefs did a fab job with the food.. we stayed here 2 nights in the standart tents, although small, its well kept and arranged, they even arranged a babycot for our little one. The pool was quite a treat although slightly cold, it was still refreshing after the morning game drives. We were fortunate to see so many game, Wildbeest. impala, waterbuck, antbuck, gazelle, hyenas, elephant, giraffe, lion, rabbit, blue stalin, ibis, plovas,
title: Heaven on earth

review: We arrived at the camp after a long, dusty and jerky drive from Lake Nakuru for a 3 day visit in August . The last 40 Kms to the lodge are terrible with roads that can rattle every bone in your body. Since it had rained earlier, the road in some stretches was slushy and at one point our vehicle got stuck in the slush - it was only with the help of some friendly Masai that we were able to move on.  The welcome was friendly and we were taken for lunch as soon as we landed even though it was after 3.30.  The camp is beautifully located on the side of a small hill and is about 30 minutes drive from the main East Gate. We were upgraded to a club tent which are marvelous. A large tent under a hard structure with a big walk in bathroom, double sinks and hot showers. The tents have a
title: One of the best holiday experiences ever!

review: Stay at Sarova Masai Mara is a truly unforgettable experience. Everything about it is excellent. Just staying in the wild, the silence, only sounds of nature, wonderful experience. As we drove in, not 500 mtrs from the the Camp we saw lions roaming, probably getting ready for a kill.   The Camp itself is excellent, the tents very nicely done, the mosquito nets, hot water bottles in the night to warm the beds, small things done very well. We enjoyed the wide variety of food, salads, the desserts and the service, everything! Walks around the place, little fishing area on the bridge, little birds, a place to mediate, the watering hole ... cant ask for more on a holiday.
title: Great Choice

review: We spent four nights at Sarova Mara in June.  The customer service at Sarova is incredible.  They really "get it".  The food is great as well, and my entire family was well taken care of from beginning to end.  We plan to return there in the future to see the Great Migration. Thanks Sarova Mara for a great experience!  The only complaint I would have is that the screens in the bathroom of the tent cabins are incomplete, leaving large gaps where mosquitoes can make their way in. I would recommend that Sarova Mara close these gaps to protect their clients.
title: Great Experience

review: Spent a weekend at the Mara Game Camp in Masai Mara. It's a great property within the Masai Mara Game park.  We opted for the higher end tents which I got to know from friends was the one to take. They were right. The tents, are intelligently built and gives you the great feeling of living in a tent without any of the hassles. When you open up the full length glass doors, you are welcomed by the king sized beds, which is adequately covered by a mosquito net. As  you walk past the bed, there you will find the decently big bathroom & toilets. These tents have to be seen to be believed - and at the cost of reiteration, these were IN the Masai Mara game park. The cutest part of the experience was the hot water pack which they placed under the bed cover in the evening - it was really
title: Great Experience

review: We were in deluxe tent #68 for 4 nights.  It was much more than we expected and we were very pleased with the double sinks, king-sized bed, large shower, and many other extras.  The hot water bottles each night with the bed turn down was great because it was quite chilly a couple of nights.  The paths to the reception area and restaurant were well cleared and lit (even though a supplied flashlight helped with the shadowy areas!)  The restaurant food was quite good, considering all the different nationalities that they tried to cater to.  The best thing of all, though, was the hospitality and friendliness of all the staff.  The game reserve drives offered so much more than I ever hoped I would see. We saw the Big 5 all in our second day, and the black rhino and leopard were seen
title: Glamp!

review: This was the third sarova camp we stayed in on our safari. The setting is great, but just too near the main gate, game drives didn't go that far into the maasai Maria and that was disappointing. All sarova camps have a buffet meal system and unfortunately the food here was not as good as the other two (Shaba and lion hill). If I am lucky enough to return for another safari I would not stay here again
title: Setting amazing

review: My wife and were upgraded to the executive tent. Wow!! what luxury. A big front porch with reclinener, two chairs and a table. Inside chairs desk, king size bed, bar fridge, walk-in shower, double sinks all beautifully decorated. Even hot water bottles at night. After games drives it was nice to take a shower and sit out on the porch with a cold tusker and watch the birds and animals. The grounds were well kept and it was very enjoyable to walk around. The staff were very friendly and attentive. Good selection of meals, all very good. The resort even had fishing poles to fish in the pond for talapia and catfish. we really enjoyed our stay.
title: absolute luxury

review: This my final task at the camp before heading to the airstrip and to Nairobi. We were here with six adults renting 3 tents. Excellent service and very polite service staff.  Safari during the morning and afternoon. Saw all the game and more! Relaxing evening through the night. All very well arranged!  The wine list is not very extensive but that was not a priority.
title: Relaxing

review: Taking step in planning what exactly you want and your budget can be a bit challenging especially when its your first time to visit that country. It all started with goggling the major attractions found and the estimated cost at least we had a clue that  led us to decide to visit Masai Mara since if lucky you could spot the Big 5(Elephant, Rhino, Lion, Leopard, Buffalo)(Wildebeest could make it to The Big 6 as we did. It was amazing!!! We contacted several companies with different quotations and lodges, we were confused at some point but we decided to to give a try with the Uniglobe Speedbird Travel & Safaris as our agent. We booked a 3Day Air Safari to Masai Mara with overnight at Sarova Mara Camp since the price was reasonable and ideally for small children. It was an
title: Amazing services with Speedbird Travel & Safaris.

review: I stayed at the Sarova Mara May 14-16. Upon arrival to the lodge I was given a warm wet towel to wipe the dust off my hands from the 5 hour drive from Nairobi. The lodge was about a 5 minute drive from the gate we entered in, which was nice having it so close instead of driving another 3 hours to any other lodge. We arrived approximately 10 minutes before lunch was supposed to end, but I found that I was still able to eat and hand a wide variety of choices! The food was better than I could have imagined (I've had some weird and bad things to eat in all my travels). When I was there the food was always fresh (even 10 minutes before lunch service ended). The service was great and people were very attentive and friendly. My only complaint was the bed was a little hard, but I'd
title: Great place to stay and close to an entrance

review: very good camp,good food,good rooms ,good location and very good services. if one wants to stay in masai mara, i suggest you to stay only at sarova mara camp.
title: Wonderful

review: Stayed here from 12-15 June after a magical wedding in Gilgil. Wonderful staff, great game drives (even when game was short on the ground, it didn't matter because of the scenery). Upgraded to a club tent because of shortage of tents with twin beds, which was far better than many hotel rooms I have stayed in.  Very friendly, helpful and welcoming staff. Would definitely recommend going on an all day game drive if you can.  Food and wine delicious - be careful of over eating!
title: The Maasi Mara is Taimed at this Camp

review: The Sarova Mara Game Camp was the last of five places that we stayed during our nine day safari and it did not disappoint us; outstanding accommodations, food and service. They even provided entertainment each night; local native dancing with audience participation and Maasai Jump Dancing.   There is only one negative comment which concerns the road leading to their main gate. It had been washed out during the rainy season which caused us to cringe every time we had to return to Camp. After a day out on the Mara with its reasonable terrain our legs and arms were bruised by the punishment of this last leg. This is a shout-out to Sarova to get the road graded.  All of our other activities were great including a pre-dawn journey to the Hot Air Balloon ride which was wonderful. We
title: Brilliant

review: My husband and I spent the last 3 nights of our safari trip to Kenya here. It was a lovely place with small deer and mongoose running around beautifully kept grounds. The tents were lovely and quite luxurious. Akorn Destination Management did a wonderful job with 2 safari's a day all with our lovely guide and driver, Robert. He was a pleasure to spend time with. Everything was so well organised. Not a hitch. . We had a balloon flight over the Masai Mara followed by a lovely breakfast in the bush..   We saw every animal we dreamed of and more, including 2 leopards. We would return anytime.
title: Wonderful end to our holiday

review: We stayed there for two nights and everything was perfect. The food, the staff, the lodge, the game-drives. We loved it. Our lodge was a vip-lodge and we had to walk for a few minutes before we were at the dining place. But that was alright. At our lodge it was very quiet an that was very nice. We wanted to visit a Masai village but when we were there it started to rain. That was bad luck. The next day we had the same weather. It started to rain at 16.00 h. When you visit the Masai Mara I recomand this place. We loved it.
title: A Fantastic place to visit the Masai Mara

review: This is the 2nd time my family has stayed here. Ken was our driver and he looked after us very well. He was constantly in touch with other drivers tracking the big game and the awesome migration. Our kids (10 &8) loved him. Staff at the beautiful lodge were very pleasant and accommodating. We had a very luxurious family tent with 2 rooms and a lounge which were kept immaculate.  Only issue was the hot water pressure in the evening but that didn't spoil the fun. Will definitely return for more. Asante
title: 2nd time fun

review: Totally fun to ride hours and hours over bumpy dirt roads and emerge at this fully outfitted luxury lodge in the middle of nowhere.  Fabulous tent-rooms with draping mosquito nets.  Extensive buffets for breakfast/lunch/dinner.  Cultural demonstrations and roving Maasai ambassadors.  Unique organic garden and the resident gardener, who puts as much fresh produce on the menu as he can.  The only thing missing on safari is exercise--due to fenced camp and limited fitness opportunities, and overwhelming food offerings, the traveller really doesn't get a good walk in (and the pool is pretty much for the youngsters).
title: Totally fun

review: Our family of six were there from 26th Sept to 30th. The usual impeccable service brought us back there for the 3rd time.On arrival at the air strip our driver Ken welcomed us with cold towels and a refreshing drink. The family and club tents were superb. Our full day game drives were organised by Ken who made sure that our lunch boxes and drinks was fully stocked. We ended our stay with a great massage by Grace and a surprise Birthday breakfast on their private lawnfor our son and grandson. Special thanks to Carol / 'Douglas / John / Gilbert for the food and service. Be assured that we shall return !! Asante Sana Sarova. Aftab and Manju Mombasa
title: Always a pleasant welcome stay

review: My family and I had an awesome experience while at the Sarova. We were there for just 2 nights, but what a stay. The food is excellent, the service was very good too. The pool was frigid though. But it is in the middle of the game reserve, so you will have a blast doing a safari.
title: Excellent hotel in the middle of Maasai Mara game reserve

review: We stayed for three nights in the end of September. We were met at the airstrip by our driver Edward ( I believe his name was, if not, so sorry, memory is going)), who stayed with us for the entire time. We where offered cool drinks before driving us to the Game Camp.  What a great place. We stayed in a club tent, very spacious with a very large bed, dressing area, lovely big bathroom with dressing gowns and slippers, and plenty of hot water, and a terrace. Although the camp is fairly big by some people's standard, the grounds are very large and how the tents are placed we felt very private, at No 68, with only greenery around.  The gardens are laid out beautiful, with lakes and bridges, and lovely plants. There is a very nice swimming pool, however we have not used it as we
title: Fantastic Holiday

review: A wonderful hotel right in the Maasai Mara park, luxury tents are equipped with everything you could want, and very well run.  Staff are wonderful and friendly.  Its  a larger place which has its pros and cons: the restaurant is large and can feel a bit less personal for example, but being larger means there are more bars, pools, spa, shop etc to use than at smaller lodges.
title: Enjoyable stay! Great safari

review: my mom and I stayed here in Dec 2010 before i was into TripAdvisor, so keep that in mind; i don't know if it has maintained itself. We highly recommend it. it was sometimes uncomfortable when the native Masai would do their traditional dance in the lobby. i thought that aspect was a bit exploitative. also the gift shop is overpriced, as most are.  the food was great and the "tent" was so cool. cozy, yet modern.  enjoy
title: Luxury tents

review: Visited Mara Sarova for the second year in a row. This year in August during the great migration. And did we enjoy it ! A wonderful clubtent, so the nights were very comfortable. Dikdiks nearby, who posed for some beautiful pictures without hesitation. Wonderful food and very friendly personnel. As returning guests we were treated tot a private dinner on the view deck, which was wonderful. In the Mara we saw (of course next to the enormous herds of wildebeasts and zebra's) a lot of young animals: lion and cheetah cubs, young giraffe, young "pumba's" etc. To much to mention. Made a lot of incredibly beautiful pictures. At the risk of forgetting someone, we would like to thank especially Chef John (delicious pepper steaks !), Caroline, Cyrus, Ruben, Emelda and the people at the
title: And again a wonderful stay at Mara Sarova

review: I've stayed in this camp more than 10 times and each stay was wonderful. Camp staff is always very friendly, tents are always clean, garden is always well maintained and the location is also very good: close to the entrance gate of the park and right in the middle of the game. If you can afford the extra bucks, i would reccomend the club tents but regular tents are also comfortable and spacious enough for 2 people. I would not reccomend a third bed in the tent. Try their bush breakfat, its well worth the money.
title: Club tents are great, children activities plenty, but food...

review: We stayed in the Sarova Mara Tented Camp in August 2012. Though it was our sixth visit to Masai Mara, we stayed in Sarova for the first time (we like to visit different properties). I forgot to mention that we are living in Kenya for many years. The camp is located next to Sekenani game, and not "right in the middle of 375 sq kms wild", as was stated in anothe review. In the end of August, during migration, while the herds have resched the middle of the park, the Sarova side still had very liitle game, and it's about 40 mins drive to see the migration. Though, there were some animals. The Club tent we stayed in was perfect. We had the last one, and though it's long walk to the main building, it was very nice. We had family of dik-dik (the smallest antelope) visiting, and they
title: Fantastic hotel!
Excellent, comfortable place to stay in the Mara

review: Those wild life enthusiasts this is a must visit. This is a life time experience. Hotel property is very conveniently located right in the middle of 375 sq kms wild. Excellent tents with shower and toilets. Good toiletries and hair drier, Beds are secured with mosquito nets for protection. Off course there are lots of mosquitoes around. You can watch and experience masai life from close quarters. The camp has decent swimming pool, badminton court and table tennis court. There is a mini gold for kids. A curio shop, spa and excellent cafe with fire place. Buffet breakfast and meals are very nice too. Indians and vegetarians there is enough to look forward to in the food section. If you happen to celebrate your birthday there they can nice cakes and get some live music band to make
title: Once in a life time expereince

review: We've been there several times - the place is excelent and the service - specially tahnsk to Caroline Murungi and Carolien Nyawira. Absoluty the place to visit if you're in Kenya. Service is friendly and of good quality. The locatoin is good :). The tents are well equiped. Kitchen is excalent - you can enhjoy everything!
