And after dinner you can enjoy tje fire wood and good music. I've been to Masai Mara several times - and also some other places - but this is absolutely the best place to visit! Try it - you won't be disappointed!
title: great hotel with good facilities

review: very very good facilties and although its on the expensive side the staff take good care of you. we arrived late but they kept the lunch open for us. bed configuration was wrong but they changed the tent by the time we got back from the game drive...they had a dental kit and the food as simply fantastic...breakfast, coffee before the game drives...dinner...simply great with indian and vegetarian options...keep it up  negatives....charges for phone are steep and internet (was not intrested in surfing but just to make sure am connected for any emergencies) was not working...thats why i am not rating it excellent...  will definately stay again...
title: Great experience, ideal for families with small children

review: We spent one night at the Sarova Mara Game camp in a family tent. Very nice accommodations. Fresh food with a lot of choice, ideal for families with children as they will always find something they like to eat.
title: Outstanding - The best holiday we have ever had.

review: We arrived in this camp as 3adults and two children ,we were meet by Masai with some drinks and clean clothes which we needed after a long drive from Nairobi. We went to check in and a lady mentioned we had been upgraded but we never thought anything of it until we reached our tent and wao wao wao will never forget for we were upgraded to the one of the only family tents in the whole camp.   Beautiful is un understatement,the family tents are two tents with a living area in the middle and with sliding doors over looking a pond at the back,rooms are immaculately clean. The food was amazing,but most of all the waiters,waitresses were so kind and nice to the kids,they talked to them,told them story's so they can eat just abit more made sure there high chairs were in place even
title: Best time ever.

review: The hotel itself is so beautiful! Lodges are very private, beds are comfortable and badroom very clean. The pool is freezing cold! But they have a tiny space for mini golf which is great for kids because it can get boring for them at times...they organized a special dinner in a hidden part of the hotel with fire, masaai people dancing, grill and all kind of kenyan food. So special! I have to say i wasnt so impressed with the food, i am a picky eater, my husband was happy with it, but i thought the other hotels we stayed at before this one had better flavor. First 25 number rooms are closest to reception....also remember, they have family lodges, which are 2 rooms joined by a small living room...(good to kow if you have kids) ...
title: Wonderful!

review: We arrived on a Sunday to find the buffet lunch being served under a gazebo on the lawn, so relaxing after a long drive from Lake Nakuru (the final 90 mins or so on a very bumpy unmade road...and this is not the road IN the park) Check in was very smooth, the staff very friendly/helpful and the tented accommodation very comfortable.  This was our second stay at this lodge and my only disappointment was no dik dik running across the ground in front of my tent when I arrived! Did they not know we'd come back to see them?! Still plenty of birds in the bushes/trees instead, very relaxing sitting outside reading and watching them in between chapters! There is a nice lake and a viewing gallery but no maribou there this time...although the gallery level was spoiled by the tea bags
title: Nice tented camp

review: Prior to going on our trip we had no idea what to expect, well we had 3 wonderful days!   On being collected from the air strip by our Sarova Camp Game Driver Ken we were taken for a short safari. Ken called it an appetiser for what we would see during the rest of the trip – it was amazing, it set the scene and we have to say, Ken was fantastic! There were a lot of people at the camp who had booked their own drivers but if you are unsure we would certainly recommend the camps own game drivers and if you can get Ken, you will be very happy indeed… we would visit again just to see our friend! On another note, the camp vehicles were all land cruisers whereas many of the other tours used Toyota Hiace 4WD which didn’t look that comfortable and sturdy!   In regard to the camp, we had
title: Our first Safari Experience was out of this world thanks to Sarova Camp!

review: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights - 24-26 December. This was our first experience in tented accommodation. And we would want to do it again! Do not expect 5 star although at those prices you would. But running a Camp at this remote location is expensive. The staff are absolutely charming. Although not trained a la a city hotel which we really don't need here, they more than make up for it with charm and courtesy. The food is a very wide spread in terms of variety. The tent is small but very well laid out with all necessities. They are spaciously laid out and we couldn't even see our next door neighbour because of tree cover. After a fall in the mud during a game drive, at 8 pm I asked for a fast track wash of my jeans and T-shirt overnight since I was leaving 7.30 am next
title: Lovely stay great food!
Read my review, you'll see what is customer satisfaction...

review: There are two types of accommodations, club tent and the normal tents. We went for the normal tents  and were pleasantly surprised to see everything packed inside so neatly. We were travelling with my 3yr old son and were provided with an extra bed in the tent. It had a small in-tent seating as well as outside seating. The tents were spotless clean, the bathroom had a curtain separation. The tents are equipped with tea coffee making facility and mineral bottle 1 per person per day. The bathroom is stocked generously with good quality toiletries. There is no room service or telephone facility in the normal tents and one has to walk up to the reception in case of any need. But it’s no problem at all since the distance is not much and generally all things are taken care off well.
title: Loved it!

review: Stayed here for my 40th with family and friends and what a great experience.   Great oasis in the Masi Mara as you drive through the front gates and the camp is only a short drive. Service is fantastic from the time you arrive. Very resort style camp with pool and grounds. Can have massages and facials when not on the drives. We had our own driver so we just paid a package through a travel agent and they sorted the accommodation.   During our stay I had a surprise birthday organised by family and friends where we had dinner with out own private chef and waiter and also the local masi did a performance for us. It was set out in the camp separate for anyone else...AMAZING!!!!  Can be a bit daunting choosing a camp but this one does not disappoint if it fits your budget.
title: 4 Nights...great food and the best service...

review: The Sarova Mara game camp is very nice and pretty much the best accommodation you can get if you are going to Kenya for safaris. The tents are very nicely done, location is ideal. The food was not fantastic but I guess it depends what you're comparing it with. For Kenya, this was the best place where we stayed. If you compare it with 5 star accommodation in Europe or the US, it's not quite at the same level. Hint: we had a couple of lizards on the wall in the bathroom - if you have issues with that, try to mentally prepare yourself for it :)
title: Pretty much best you can get in Kenya

review: We stayed here for three days in the end of September.  It was the end of the great migration, so we didn't get to see anything being killed but we did see all of the big 5 (lion, cheetah, leopard, rhino, and Cape buffalo) as well as many other awesome animals.  The accommodations were wonderful.  The food was standard for an all-inclusive and the staff was very, very nice.
title: Great Experience

review: My friends and I made a repeat stay at the Sarova Mara Camp from 18th to 21st October 2012. The repeat was motivated by a wonderful earlier stay at the camp five years ago. But we were disappointed! The following are the reasons:  I did the booking from the Stanley, Nairobi, (where the booking was handled very professionally and I looked forward to another great time) for 3 tents with 2 double beds each, but when we checked in at the camp, we were given tents with two little single beds (we were mature adults!). The reservations staff insisted that the camp only had this size of beds despite me reminding them that I had been to the camp before and been checked into a tent with two large beds. At the end of the day, it appeared like we were seeking to favours! We were eventually
title: Deteriorating standards: Confused booking specifications, no manager-client relationship, lights off, no variety in food

review: We had a great stay at Sarove Mara Game Camp. A tent is more comfortable and luxurious than most hotel rooms.   Location in the the park is great making an excellent base to explore the park and see animals.  As we travelled as a couple we found the resort to be bit loud, if you can upgrade to Club tent, they have a view to the park, much bigger and provide excellent privacy. We did and found it be a great idea.  Finally what this made this property the best one we stayed in Kenya is the service, check-in, management everybody want to help you. We decided to upgrade from a regular tent to club tent, this was arranged at reasonable price by the manager who personally walked with to ensure that we liked the view and the tent. The club tents are spectacular with his / her sinks,
title: Wonderful place in the Maasai Mara National Park

review: You enter the main area through a bridge over a deep moat type stream which suggests security from the jungle! This was welcome when we realized that the reason, they weren't handing us the keys to our rooms was because there were none! Zips were the only safeguard to our luxury tents! Creepy crawling are kept a safe distance by the netted bedsides! Enjoyed the quaint large box to store valuables! The plug points are fiddly and on the floor, so can be a pain to plug in mosquito mats! I used the plug in the attached bathroom to charge cameras etc, as it was the only one fitted with adapter friendly plugs!  Nice pool with friendly wildlife wandering within the lodge area including the usually shy dik dik deer especially early in the morning! Nice bird life! Friendly bar area to
title: Excellent and more...
Charming, but a little rough around the edges

review: Jambo! Oh what a place we found. Ive travelled my fair share around the world but this place just blew us away with its beauty and service.Now before i review this place i must tell you that if you're a first time visitor to the mara you should know that you will be spending a maximum of 5-6 hours at the mara doing your game drives, the rest of the time you shall be spending in your lodge which is why the sarova mara is the ideal place to be in.  The staff is excellent and takes care of all your needs whatever it may be. The food is excellent and is on par with any of the top hotels in the world served buffet style for breakfast,lunch and dinner and includes all cuisines from italian,indian,asian,continental,steaks,etc and the desserts are to die for.  We met people from all
title: Loved It

review: I highly recommend to stay in this beautiful resort, made in the form a large number of tent like guest rooms. The rooms are well maintained. Everynight the bed is turned down and a hot water bottle is put in the bed. The settings is great with an oasis looking atmosphere. Staff are well attentive to guest's needs and are doing their best to keep you happy. Food is great and during my three days stay, I never found any food in their very large buffet that I did not like. Drinks are a bit expensive, especially their non-alcoholic fruit drinks, but other than that I found everything great and highly recommend a stay ion this beautiful and very well maintained resort.
title: A highly recommended resort in the heart of Masai Mara National Park

review: Wow firstly staff r great they have the ethos nothing isctoobmuch. Second food is amazing not a great variety Sabin sarivavwhite sands but the quality if what is there is great. Fresh grills soups and breads excellent. You are staying in a tent but with a permanent attached bathroom, this not give much privacy when going to toilet especially with a dodgy tummy but is quite romantic. The swimming pool water is cold and not heated but u get used to it, the best but was the open fires at night and having a whiskey in the open air by the fire at night. Very good hitel
title: Amazing   Place

review: Our family stayed here for two, wonderful nights. The camp is beautiful, well maintained, and very comfortable; but the service was exceptional. Everyone was friendly, glad to help and so good with our 8 and 10 year old kids. After a morning game drive, we returned to cool, towels, a delicious lunch, and a clean room. The staff played with our kids in the pool, took them fishing and supplied archery equipment. It was an absolutely wonderful stay and I highly recommend a stay at this beautiful place in an amazing location.
title: Wonderful stay

review: Well kept game lodge with excellent service from front desk staff especially Caroline and Alex and also the restaurant staff especially James who was full of enthusiasm for the place and the company he works for. This guy could be your PR manager.  Overall simply brilliant. Small complaint - I cannot fathom hotels that charge for WIFI. I say add it to the room rate and don't make it an extra charge.   They deserve the full five stars. Keep it up. Will certainly comeback and tell as many people I can to do the same. Asante Sana!
title: Fantastic place with service and comfort to match.

review: Loved everything about it specially the bfast , lunch and dinner buffet varieties.  So much variety every day... Loved the tented rooms concept. Travelled back in 2009 but writing review now.... Loved the authenticity of the Masai people at the village.  And their spooky lifestyles.  The best game reserve ever and we spotted the big 5. After doing this safari u will never feel the need to do any other safari.
title: Awesomeness!

review: The Mara Sarova was a great place to stay.  We were here for two nights and really enjoyed it.  It looks pretty fancy from the second you pull up and the reception area is enormous.  The tented accommodation was awesome!  Comfortable bed and quite spacious, but the height at the sides of the tent was a little squishy.  It was very clean and well presented.  The hot water took a long time to come through, but it eventually did!    The facilities of the camp are fantastic, with a nice bar and restaurant.  There was a lot of variety in the food.  There was great entertainment each night and the Masai dance was the best that we saw throughout our travels.  The staff were very attentive and obliging.  There are dik dik's roaming the camp grounds and they are so cute!  Beware -
title: If it's good enough for Richard Branson....

review: A very good camp style cottages in the midst of a dense forest.  Perfect settings to share an extension of the Masai Mara.  Cottages are a bit small. ( My height at 6 ft 2, needed to bend down at some places in the tent. But no major complaints on this count.  The bed was very comfortable to sleep.  The exteriors of the tent was a dense forest full of birds.  During the day, the chirping makes you feel that you are sleeping in teh forest itself.  Good Restuarant.  Indian Food also available.  Good continental and kenyan cuisine too.  Excellent service.  Good bar.  Would want to stay once more at this place.
title: Second Time at Sarova Mara, Would Stay There Again!

review: This was my second time staying at the Sarova Mara and I enjoyed it as much as I did the first time.  As with the first time, I made my reservations through Voyage Safaris Ltd.  I have nothing but praises for Voyage Safaris Ltd, since they planned my entire Kenya trip and I enjoyed every minute of it.    In Sarova Mara you stay in "tents" which are in no way similar to traditional tends.  As mentioned by previous reviewers, it's pretty much a house structure that looks like a tent from the outside.  There are hardwood floors, in-door plumbing, etc.  The tents are beautiful and the beds are very comfortable.  I went with my family, comprised of all adults.  However we did see children at Sarova and they appeared to be enjoying themselves.  The children especially enjoyed the
title: Unexpected

review: This place is fantastic. Your greeted as soon as you get out of your vehicle with a wet cloth to wash your hands with. As soon as you walk across the bridge to reception your instructed to go to the bar and have a drink while they check you in. Your bags are carried to your tent and you are given a tour of your tent and how everything works. Elecricity is turned off from midnight to 4am. We chose a club tent which is by far as good as a 4 star hotel. Patio, walk in shower, comfortable beds with mosquito netting, dressing area, robes, slippers, mini bar, desk, turn down service and much more. No keys to your room, only zippers or doors on club tents. Property has electic fence, very safe. Food superb. Game drives twice a day with your driver guide, the most eciting part of all.
title: Fantastic!
Lo mejor del Masai Mara ( Para españoles Pregunten por Saitoti)

review: A luxury hotel! Very good service, by far the best of Kenya. They also have a Masai guy in reception who speaks English and Spanish, is called Koitumet Saitoti, For a Spanish-speaking person like me was a real pleasure to know i Saitoti, good disposition, friendly and luxurious attention. The best hotel in Kenya!
title: An Experience to remember !

review: the sarova Mara Game Camp is an experience to cherish, their tented rooms are fabulous and are as close to nature as it can get.   The food was superb and the game drives simply exciting. The staff goes out of their way to serve you and ensure your comfortable.   The buffet meals were delicious and quite a fabulous spread including indian dishes and even indian vegetarian meals like simple dal and rice were a delight.   Their deserts are unforgettable and you can just not stop at one :)   a must stay property while in the Mara.
title: Wonderful Stay

review: We recently stayed here for two nights in January and enjoyed it very much.  Our tent had a comfortable king size bed, netting,  and was very roomy.  Similar to the other resorts, all meals were served buffet style.  There was a wide variety of food and it was extremely good.  Both soup and salads were “live prepared”.  This meant someone would create them the way you liked  - a very nice touch.  The young lady who prepared the soup was a delight. Except for one exceptionally rude waiter at night, the staff was friendly if not terribly outgoing.     Electricity was turned off mid afternoon and late at night which was common in the tented camps. The tents had a hair dryer and a burner to get rid of insects.  For such a nice place it was strange to have thin and somewhat worn
title: Review of Mara Sarova

review: After a very long and rough drive in from Nairobi (but exciting) this was like an oasis just stunning.  We stayed in the 5 star tents with king size beds and ensuites . Every morning and evening we were greeted by a family of dikdiks so cute. At night we were entertained by the Masai people and the food was Devine. Loved the sarova lodge chain of hotels they are all stunning. All your washing is done which is great when away for a few months like we were.
title: Oasis in the dessert

review: Sarova Mara provided a luxurious retreat within the Masa Mara where we could relax in style between game drives. It offered a pool area complete with bar service, special evening valentine"s dinner in the gardens, a buffet restaurant with lots of variety, beautiful grounds and luxurious tented camps complete with king beds, mosquito netting and beautiful tile bathrooms with large walk in showers. The tented camps all had decks for lounging with many having views overlooking the Mara. Staff was very friendly and service was good. an on site travel rep was available to book excursions from hot air ballooning to masai village visits or walking safaris. all in all a wonderful place to spend several days. The area is renowned for having sitings of all of the Big 5. This was delivered
title: Now this is "glamping"

review: This place is awesome!  The safari portion is incredible with great drivers/guides, and really cool open top landrover jeeps. They have a few options for when you go out on safari too.  The hotel is incredible - the lobby is really cool, great gift shop, great pool area and wi-fi that you pay for. The food there is incredible!! It's buffet style but it's all so incredibly good with tons of different styles of food to choose from.  The tent-rooms are amazing. It's a luxury hotel room inside a tent basically. Really comfortable beds, great linens, great shower with hot water and good water pressure. Totally beautiful grounds too. You will hear the wildlife at night which can be really loud at times, and they shut the power off at midnight and it's so dark you can't see your hand
title: the best of the bunch of sarova hotels stayed at whilst on safari in kenya

review: I was not expecting to find such a nice place in the middle of the savannas, it definitively makes your safari experience even more spectacular.   The rooms are really cozy, the tent instead of the concrete walls enhances the experience, but it doesnt mean you will no have comfort, once the tent is very spacious, with a comfortable king size bed, and a very decent bathroom (this one in concrete walls). You can easily forget that you in a Natural Reserve and only the animal's noises in the middle of the night remember you where you are.  The hotel infrastructure in general e pretty decent, especially considering that you are not going to spend many hours in the hotel. Food is ok, dont expect 5 stars dishes, but you can find good quality food and some variety in the buffet.   The
title: A gem in the middle of the Maasai Mara Reserve

review: Sarova Mara Game Camp is an extraordinary place, from which to launch your experience of the Masai Mara, which is an extraordinary experience. The food, the accommodation, the staff were all fantastic, and of course being in the park and the safaris were the greatest aspect of it all. Just an amazing experience. We traveled in June 2011.
title: Awesome!

review: By far the most amazing resort I've ever been to! ( and am not just saying this coz am from Kenya). Everything was perfect. The food, the tents the staff. We absolutely had no complains at all. The resort is a little pricy but u get what u paid for. Cannot wait to go back.
title: GREAT STAFF..

review: This was the most amazing place I have ever stayed. As is emphasized in the other reviews, it isn't only the property and location that make the experience, the staff are top notch as well. The photos on the website don't do it justice. And as it says on the site, you ARE the personal guest of the Camp Manager - thanks James - you are the consummate host. They managed every detail of our stay so that we didn't have to do anything - just show up at the appointed time - very relaxing. Special thanks to MOSES our  Guide Extraordinaire. He went out of his way to make sure we didn't miss seeing any animal. His impromptu quizzing ensured that I not only learned the difference between the many types of antelope.but we booked through a local company based in diani beach called
title: Great staff, "campy" tents

review: The Sarova Mara is my favorite hotel of all time. We spent 10 days in Kenya on a mission trip with friends and finished our stay at the Mara. I came in not expecting to love the safari experience, but I was completely blown away! We were met at the landing strip with fresh juices, cool towels, and Tony our driver. He also was our safari guide for the weekend, and he was the best. We immediately went on a game drive, and the landscape was breathtaking!   The hotel is absolutely magnificent. You enter through a long covered bridge to an outdoor lobby made of beautiful dark woods. The lodge encompasses beautiful hardwoods and natural stone. Massai warriors give a show in the lobby for guests with traditional dancing. The restaurant is also beautiful with a gourmet buffet of items
title: Magnificent is an Understatement
This place can not be beat.

review: Stayed in Mid-April. Excellent reception, very clean facility, well staffed. Even have in-house doctor. Standard room was extremely comfortable. Everything you need is in the room. Food was buffet style and much of it cooked to order. Nice pool. Generators go off between 2400 and 0400. Flash-light and candles in room. Would stay there again without a doubt. Highly recommended. No need to look elsewhere during your safari.
title: Amazing!!

review: We stayed here for two nights while doing game drives they the Mara. I am not a camper, but was able to survive in these tents!! King sized bed, running water and hot water bottles at night made me a happy camper!! There are no doors or locks just tent zippers. We had no problems with this at all. The staff was friendly and helpful and the food was the best!! Best bread pudding for dessert! We saw a lot of animals while game driving and even got stuck in the mud super close to a herd of elephants.  We even visited the Maasai village while staying here.  That was an Experience I will never forget and I would recommend it. Just wear some closed toe shoes you will walk thru mud and cow dung. You will learn a lot from them and how different we live. We loved coming back at night and
title: Very nice stay

review: We enjoyed every moment at Sarova. The club tents were amazing, the food was superb, everything about Sarova was amazing, but the best of all among everything was two things: being at the heart of Maasai Mara and being surrounded by the wild life. We look forward staying there when we do another safari at Masaai Mara.
title: Amazing Experience!

review: We came to the Mara after a wonderful 2 days in Loisaba.   We were met at the airstrip by Danielle who would be our guide and drive for the next 3 nights.  We stayed in the Club Tents, LARGE, huge well laid out tents. I love the concept. Full tent below a tiled roof structure. The rear of the tent has a bricked bathroom with all the amenities.  I loved the way they would prepare the tents each night, Zip down each 'window' cover the bed with mosquito nets (doubt there were any!) . Neatly done.  Food and service were great. The staff is very professional and always there on call. We had our tables reserved automatically each time and it was fine.  Now, game drives, we did 2 per day, early morning out by 0630 and back by 0915 for breakfast. Afternoon out by 1530 and back way later
title: Masai Mara in all its splendour

review: Just inside Masai Mara Reserve this Sarova lodge offers an average lodgment for people who do not mind to be in a resort with lots of other guests. Meaning this isn't the place where you feel special and a valuable guest. You do not see luxury in this place, you can instead have a good service from nice people who are willing to offer you a nice stay with them. If you don't have hign expectations this place is more than OK. It's a big place. A huge restaurant with inside area and a balcony where you have all meals. A great lawn which sadly is not used for nothing (they could have meals or tea/coffee there but no). The lodgmente offers only tents, which by the way are very reasonable: bathroom is not made by the tent but rather in bricks which offers more safety. The bed is
title: amazing location and superb service/amenities

review: Never sleeping in a tent before I was skeptical in what to expect. This tent was something I never would have expected. Large, teak flooring in the sleeping  area,  a large tiled permanent modern bathroom with all amenities excluding a hair dryer, large shower stall. The beds were comfy and we never had any problems with mosquitoes and insects. All precautions were taken by the staff. A dressing area with desk, a lot of zipper windows and a teak platformed siting area in the front of tent with teak patio chairs and table to sit and enjoy the sights and sounds of the wildlife. The lodge itself was all open air except the dining area and bar. The food was excellent and many different dishes to try. All of the staff were very helpful and friendly. The bar area was the evening
title: Kenya Safari
Beautiful camp with Deluxe Tent Accomodation

review: Yes, you are sleeping in a tent - but a 5 star tent! Full bath, clean, coffee, etc... Friendly staff, great buffet breakfast, lunch, dinner and boxed lunch on safaris. Nice pool and in an excellent location. Would definitely stay there again.
title: Simply lovely!

review: The most luxurious tented camp I've stayed in and I've stayed in many!  The food service is well above average with a combination of buffet and cooked-on-the-spot entrees.  Overall service is excellent with very well intentioned staff.  Everything is sparkling clean! Grounds and pool are very well maintained.  Family friendly for kids with extra activities for down time. Masseuse Grace was excellent.  We experienced both the regular tents and the more upscale Club tents.  The Club tents are over the top and exceedingly nice!  Best for those who are over 5'5".  The regular tents are also very nice but if you are over 5'3" be prepared to stoop over a bit to get around. Unfortunately, the twin beds were pushed together in the middle of the tent so one should be very cozy with
title: Luxury "tents" are my kind of camping-- it's really a "tent-hotel."
Beautiful, comfortable hotel in the middle of nowhere!

review: A great place right inside the Masai Mara reserve. Good hospitality and India tourist friendly. The tents are comfortable. In some months it might get cold but it is enjoyable. The right option if you are going to Masai Mara. The prices are all inclusive as there are no other places to eat in the middle of the grassland and hence sometimes the food feels boring. Make it a point to stay closer to the restaurant area if you have kids and senior citizens with you. Overall an awesome experience.
title: Right inside the Masai Mara Reserve

review: I pined over the decision to either go budget or upscale for my safari at the end of a 6 week backpacking trip though East Africa. I paid extra for the upgrade and I was not disappointed. I stayed here for two nights and for one at the Sarova Lion Hill Lodge in Lake Nakuru and I am now a huge fan of the brand. I mention both locations here to highlight how consistent my experience was. The "tent" is one of the most romantic places my wife and I have ever stayed at and the buffet meals were much better than we expected. It would be difficult to go with with this company and leave disappointed. I'll also add that the the staff at Sarova is some of the most well trained and professional I've seen anywhere.
title: One of the coolest places I've stayed at in the world

review: i went with my family and few friends a while back the tents are brilliant although there was no hot water in the showers! the beds were very comfy and the tents were big! the staff and food were lovely, think this was one of the best places we stayed in on safari!
title: loved it!

review: The setting itself of this camp is amazing, serene, tranquil and once you are there a sense of Adventure overcomes you. During our stay we were treated to mouth watering buffets, Live guitar music and not to forget the unique 'Bush' Lunch. The staff were very friendly and the Accommodations were perfect. Thank you Sarova Mara Game Camp.
title: The Best Game Camp in The Masai mara

review: Very nice lodge with very friendly staff, excellent restaurant, excellent wine but rather expensive, beautifull garden, nice swimmingpool, comfortable  tents. It was nice being there. We will recommand it to our friends.
title: Mara Sarova game lodge

review: In the middle of the savannah in a tent.  Add a comfy king sized bed, hot shower, and hot water bottle.  Who could ask for anything more?  The food was wonderful; lived the masai dancers.  The park itself is spacious and full of wildlife, although you may have to drive a ways to find it.
title: Pampered plus!

review: I would like to take this opportunity to thank you so much for a fantastic holiday for myself and my family at Mara Sarova Camp. Your organisation and attention to detail ensured that every part of our holiday flowed seamlessly. The standard of tents, food, customer service was excellent. Thank you also for giving us an upgrade, it truly was out of this world. The staff looked after us so well, the food was excellent, the standard of the accommodation was luxurious and the scenery and setting was simply stunning. I cannot recommend highly enough the early morning game drive safari, and not forgetting the migration.  it is a must for anyone visiting the Masai Mara. The food produced by the chef’s was astounding (better than many restaurants!)  Thank you again for organizing a
title: Excellent service

review: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of our safari, it was brilliant. It was a tent, but it had a solid wood floor, huge double bed and a brick built bathroom area with a huge shower area and his and hers sinks. Our tent was right on the edge of the Masai Maria national park so you could lie in bed and listen to the animals at night, one night we could hear lions!! The hotel area looked really nice and all the staff were friendly and very helpful, the food in the restaurant was lovely and there was plenty of selection, as we were leaving early on our last day they put on breakfast for us early, which was appreciated. All in all, I can't wait to go back, and that will definitely be happening!
title: Much more than a tent!

review: Having never been on a safari, I was not sure what to expect from the Sarova Mara tented game camp.   From the wet towels to wipe off the dust when we arrived to the luxurious tents, the entire weekend was  a great experience.
title: Best Camping Trip - Awesome Setting

review: My wife and I recently stayed at the Sarova Mara Game Camp and it was absolutely fantastic! The accommodation was amazing, the service incredible, and everything else – the food, the atmosphere, the facilities etc. – were brilliant. We were lucky enough to stay in a Club Tent, which I’d highly recommend.   We’d like to say a huge thank you to Simon (Bar Manager) and his team for the wonderful private dinner, and to the rest of the crew for making our stay so memorable.
title: An awesome place to stay!

review: My wife and I booked for a national park and coastal resort holiday in wonderful Kenya and this was done via John Ndegwa at Aramati Safaris in Nairobi (Note to readers that John and his team are fantastic and went out of their way to organise from start to finish our holiday and made it extra special. The organisation from the greeting at Nairobi Airoprt to Masai Mara to Mombassa beach resort and back to take off at Nairobi was excellent).   The Savora Mara Game Camp was brilliant in all respects...tent was great, staff were friendly, pleasant and efficient. Thank you and we will be back.
title: Fantastic hotel in wonderful Kenya

review: Well what can i say about the overall experience...It was a wonderful experience to visit the Maasai Mara game camp and stayed at the Sarova mara hotel...Living in a tent (#28) in jungle was a unique yet enjoyable experience and on top of it hotel was good enough to support it...Though this time i came on a business visit and took off to see the Maasai life but next time definitely i will bring my family along with me to see things more closely and in detail to enjoy it to fullest...Hats off to Sarova for maintaining such a property in the Jungle...Keep it up.
title: Tent in Jungle . . . Maasai Mara

review: Sarova Mara is probably one of the best places to stay while visiting Masai Mara. It is truly an oasis with a lot of green all around. Excellent accommodation (barring the long walk to the tent), good food and very helpful staff.  Pro Location Accommodation Ambience  Staff/Service  Cons Distance from the reception to the tent (stayed in Tent 61)
title: Mara Oasis ... Simply Superb

review: The Sarova Mara is a beautiful, carefully laid-out and extremely well-maintained camp. But the real star of our stay was our guide, Ken Kisio. He was knoweldgable, patient, kind and good company and just brilliant at getting us to the best possible location to see the widest possible range of wildlife. We were only in the Masai Mara for 3 days (and spent one of those in a balloon) and yet saw all the big 5 and much, much more. He was terrific.   The only slight disappointment with our trip was the food at the hotel. Too much choice and none of it very good. The meat was unchewably tough, the bread dry and tasteless. This is fairly basic stuff that a hotel of such otherwise good quality should be able to get right.
title: Wonderful place, great guide

review: We did stay here 3 nights with our children (8 and 10 yo) this to have a perfect closing of our great safari with Africa Veterans Safaris.  Helpful and friendly staff and a great location. The connected family tents are just perfect ! During breakfast, lunch and dinner everybody was very attentive and helpfull !  Very happy that we had this very positive experiene !
title: Just Perfect !

review: First time here and just loved it. We upgraded on arrival to one of the luxury tents overlooking the camp and were not disappointed. made such a difference and the extra cost was worth it. The peace and tranquility were almost overwhelming. The tents themselves were just lovely. When we stayed the temperatures dropped a bit at night and it was quite cold. the best thing ever one night was walking back to the tent in the evening after dinner and finding three hot water bottles had been placed in our bed! What a lovely touch that was, and so needed :)  All staff were lovely and friendly, and always at great pains, especially in the restaurant, to explain all the daily dishes to you. Must admit, I am quite used to going to hotels where the buffet dinners are huge and high quality
title: Loved it!
Home away from home that is Mara Sarova Game Camp

review: Our 6th visit to this camp was met with the same hospitality as with the previous trips. Ken our driver received us with a cold glass of passion juice.Then he took us for a  3 hour game drive  and had the pleasure to see the king of the jungle with 3 females and 8 cubs.What a start to our 5 day trip. The team led by manager Francis F. @ B.manager Mike cook Gilbert  barman Daqlous and the restof the staff were impeccable in their service and made sure that all our needs were met. Once again bravo and well done Saravo group you make us proud. We will be back you can be assured of that !
title: The Sarova Mara rocks!

review: My family (me, husband, 8 year old daughter and father) recently stayed at the Sarova Mara Game Camp for 2 nights as the first stop on our 7 day safari and it was first class all the way. We got the "family" tent, which is 2 tents inside a large cabin which was spacious and had everything we needed (flashlight, mosquito ring, bottled water etc). The food was excellent, lots of variety including Indian vegetarian and some African dishes which were nice to try. My daughter loved the tilapia.  The service was outstanding, and we felt very spoiled. There were so many nice things, such as how staff went into the tents in the evening and put down the mosquito nets and put a hot water bottle in the bed, to having a special birthday cake for my dad, complete with sparkler, which they
title: Simply amazing!

review: Fantastic place to stay; Loved the luxury tents and the grounds were beautiful.  The food was very good - especially the Indian dishes and Gilbert the chef was lovely he made fresh nan to order and cooked fantastic curries. Staff all very helpful and fun place to stay .
title: Fantastic base for our safari adventure

review: Great rooms, great food, good entertainment, the location of the hotel is very close to the park gate so make it shorter to get there from Nairobi, the is a nice pool and other activities which make it perfect to go with kids!
title: Great family experience

review: This is  very good 'tented' camp in The Mara reserve. The food and service were excellent with cheerful staff. It is very accesible to the major game areas being right in the reserve run by the Kenya Wildlife Service.
title: Darsi'choice

review: First the positives...the waitstaff was absolutely outstanding and extremely friendly.  Simon, Emelda and the sweet Linda Alila led this fabulous group.  This resort takes great pride in having a variety of food each day.  The location of this establishment is great despite the rough terrain leading to the entrance.  The grounds are clean and beautiful.    The biggest drawback for me was the lack of views from the tents.  They provide a nice patio but most of them face nothing but heavy brush.  After an unpleasant first day (2 males) with the front desk, things improved.  I thought that this resort had a focus on nickling and diming its guests.  They would have every desert under the sun for all meals but then sell ice-cream in the afternoon.  This was the first time I was
title: Slightly Disappointed

review: We were very satisfied with the service and with the food at the Mara Sarova resort. We in particular wanted to praise the chef Gilbert Meambisi who was a pleasure to deal with. Gilbert was very friendly, his cooking skills, we believed to be brilliant as he catered very well for vegetarians and people from the Jain community. Also, Gilbert's customer service skills were excellent. We were very pleased with the resort and the food provided at the resort and were grateful with the hospitality.
title: Feedback- VEGITERIAN- JAIN FOOD AND CAMP

review: The tents are actually wooden cabins without side walls in the bed area (there are real walls in the bathroom area) and a tent inside them. So overall the hotel is a lot like the Sarova Lodge at Lake Nakuru but with some canvas walls. The tents don't lock up - there is a safe and also a chest that you could lock if you brought your own padlock. So to be on the safe side I took my laptop everywhere with me in a backpack. I thought it was safer to bring it than leave it in left luggage at our hotel in Nairobi. Probably it's safe to leave it in your room but I was cautious. I also felt safe walking around the grounds which are protected from wild animals by electric fences. There is forest on the grounds of the hotel and a herd of dikdik antelopes that are like very large rabbits.
title: Actually it's Quite Like the Lion Hill Lodge at Lake Nakuru

review: I visited at five lodges in Kenya and Tanzania during my trip.  This was easily the best expereince.  Your tent comes with a roof overhead, a queen sized bed, a beautiful tiled walk-in shower, hot running water, a desk, wardrobe cabinet and wifi.  This is extraordinary comfort in an accommodation that allows you to fall asleep listening to the night sounds all around you, including some pretty dramatic renditions from tree hyrax.  The grounds are lovely, the pool is very inviting, the bar is a relaxed and comfortable place to meet others or just reflect upon the sights of the day.  The food buffet was expansive, the service very cheerful and I  just loved the soup station where I could watch while a customized version of the day's soup was concocted to suit my preference.  As
title: Luxurious tents, great staff

review: This is tent camping like no other. Upon checking in here, a companion asked for the key card. The person at the counter said none was needed as you just unzip your quarters. She was a bit taken back by this but then realized we would really be sleeping in tents. How wonderful to be in such surroundings while during the day experiencing a safari. As other reviewers stated there is quite a bit of a walk from the check in to many of the tents. If someone has difficult walking a distance, please be advised that it would be best to request closer accommodations prior to your arrival. Our friend was graciously accommodated when we realized that it was a bit difficult for her to safely navigate the grounds especially after dinner because of the distance and the evening lighting. At
title: Experience of a life time

review: We were picked up by Antony from the Serena hotel on the Masai Mara Triangle. It was a great drive from one to the other and a very different environment from the Mara Triangle, a lot greener and more off road driving so you got closer to the animals. As this was our third stop of four we knew what to expect on arrival and were not disappointed, cold towels and a drink. The only downside was not our room was not ready and we had to wait for a couple of hours to be shown our accommodation, which was not to much of a problem as we had lunch. The wait for the accommodation was well worth it WOW what can I say, it was fantastic to call it at tent is an understatement and at night hot water bottles in the bed fantastic service.   The game drives were great and Tony was very
title: sense of adventure

review: This is a fab place to stay to get the feel of Africa, sleep in a luxury tent. We stayed right by a family of Dik Dik's (Little deer/buck), we watched them play and bounce around right outside our tent, it was wonderful! The bed is comfy and it's just great to sleep closer to nature but with all the modern comforts! Worth the money! The decor has an old English explorer feel to it with a treasure chest and safari deck chairs. Wonderful! And you must do a hot air balloon trip too, while staying in the Mara. Trust me, it's worth the money, those memories stay with you for life. I saw Hyena's hunting , the sort of thing you can only see from the air. Fab!
title: Great Service

review: I travelled with my family and friends (1 yr old and 5 yr old boys) and had an amazing time.  All the staff were friendly and always bent over backwards to accommodate us.  A special thank you to chef Gilbert who catered for us being vegetarians and also made lovely meals for the little one.  I would also like to mention how great the management and reception staff were, especially Stephen, Who was always happy to help with a great big smile.
title: Amazing place, amazing people!

review: We greatly enjoyed our 4 night stay at this property.  The staff were very, very nice.  They did everything they could to make sure our stay was comfortable.  The restaurant staff deserve special mention.  Nancy (Trainee 1), Esmelda were so warm and caring.  My daughter bonded with them and loved how sensitive they were to her needs.  The bathroom is of a nice size and the rooms are also of a nice size.  The breakfast buffet and the dinner buffet were elaborate.  One could get things such as eggs made to order for breakfast and for lunch and dinner one could get pasta made to order.  The passion juice is worth trying.  Enjoyed their hot desserts such as ginger pudding, banana pudding.  You can have your soup spiced up to suit your taste.  In the evenings one can gather around
title: Superb staff, outstanding camps

review: This was my second trip to the Mara Game Camp. Our group of 8 were picked up at the airstrip by Edward and Daniel. They were both excellent guides and very informative. We were greeted with smiles at the front desk by Carolyn. Our tents were perfect and I loved the hot water bottles in the beds. The food was good and there was a good variety. I got a great massage by Grace. She is wonderful. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. When I had a problem opening the safe security was there within 10 minutes! I would say this is definitely 5 star!
title: Superb, Stunning and Friendly

review: It is not often that I cannot wait to return from a trip in order to write a review (In fact i hate writing reviews) but my recent family stay at Sarova Mara Camp compelled me to say something. The most friendliest staff, great food (Traditionally i despise Buffet) that catered for the varying taste of my family. The staff could not do enough for my family looking after our 12 year old boy who commented he was sad to leave. The environment is clean, Dik-Dik play on the lawn and the salt lick was visited by Buffalo, Hyena, Warthog and Rhino during our 5 night stay.  Breakfast in the bush after our Balloon ride was a delight. Than you to management and Staff (In particular Mike, Mohammed, Esmeralda) .... we will certainly be back next year
title: Hakuna Matata!

review: Permanent tent accommodation, very comfortable, had it's own personality, lots of lawn area, staff were very good, huge range of food at each meal from the buffet set up, and all was delicious. Be aware of the long dirt road in, but WOW is it worth it, from the surroundings to the adventure.
title: Amazing experience

review: Grabbing a cocktail at the bar by the fire after an afternoon game drive is absolutely relaxing. Maasi dance show daily at 7:30pm should not be missed. All the staff on the property are extremely friendly and helpful. Individual tent may seem to be close to each other at first, but each is quite well separated/hidden by tall plants and bushes.
title: Great experience

review: I stayed here because of a working meeting. My stay was indeed very confortable. All the confort is provided in the tent, including hot water bottles, hot shower, mosquito repellents, etc. The bed is superior in confort. I asked for an extra blanket in the second night and it came in a few minutes. The food is very good with lots of choices on all the dishes - and the idea of a "taylored" soup is great. You can do a lot of wildlife viewing even inside the camp: the surroundings, with lots of water, lush vegetation and gardens are place for the Dick-Dick, bushbucks and a variety of birds. Recommend for meetings but, of course, you can also make it a good base to go on game drives. The only problem I encountered: the tents are quite close together - at least the numbers 41 to 45 -
title: Great stay!

review: The perfect retreat after a stunning safari with Go Kenya tours and safaris..Ideally situated inside the game reserve minutes away from a multitude of wild animals.A lovely bar with a welcome fire at the end of a long game drive .Great choice of quality food and great service in a pleasant terraced restaurant.Excellent well appointed luxury tents with full shower and toilet facilities en- suite! The nightly hot water bottles were a nice touch . The staff were attentive and delightful  .  Luxury 5 star facilities and service .
title: Stunning property

review: I do really appreciate the management of Sarova Mara game camp for the kind of training they offered me while i was an intern at the premise,they gave me an opportunity to offer my services to the esteemed guests visiting the Masai Mara from all over the world. Thanks goes to the General Manager who was very helpful in all the undertakings i had in the game camp. Thanks so much Sarova family at large!!
title: In training

review: Wonderful spot in the nature reserve, great place to start exploring and even better place to spend the nights and the time between game drives. Staff is very well trained and tries everything to please the guests. Full board is ample and tasty but all buffet style and it is not the resort's fault when other guests have trouble with lining up and waiting. The 'tents' are very nicely done and surprisingly well equipped, but we had an extra bed in there and it got a bit cramped. There are little extras like warm water bottle in your bed and turned down mosquito net when you return from dinner which just guarantee a smile and a very good sleep. We had no idea there was a pool, we did not get to try it, but nice to know there is one.  My only 'gripe' might be that given the reviews
title: Out camping in style

review: This camp is very well equipped and run and the staff are really friendly, always wanting to help. The grounds are well looked after but fenced in for your safety. Whilst you do sleep in tents, they are luxurious and as this is a large "tented camp", it lacks the intimate atmosphere of some of the smaller Mara camps. The dining area is substantial and the food is, for the most part, very varied and well prepared. The hot vegetables were always spot on and not overcooked. However, quite a bit of the meat served was over done or dry. I took a Safaricom dongle with me as I had been using it elsewhere and managed to use it to get internet access. What impressed us, was the professional way the staff dealt with us and we could not praise our driver, Ken, highly enough. He took a
title: Large but well run camp
The best resort I´ve ever been to!

review: Can definitely recommend this resort. The service was amazing, the people working there were amazing.   We got picked up at the landing stripe, with towels and fresh juice. We then drove to the Resort, had a few stops on the way to look at all the animals.  They had a great restaurant, very vegetarian friendly.   We had our own driver, which took us out in the morning and afternoons. He was great at explaining things and finding the animals.   At night, they put heating pillows in the beds, so that they would be warm when we went to bed.   We got more than we paid for and I would love to go back just for the people and the service.
title: Back to   Sarova Masai Mara

review: The place is more than worth visiting. We were 6 people, 3 of then first time visiting Kenya and absolutely enjoyed our stay :). The place is fabulous, food is excalent (all your special requirements are taken into consideration ),  migration was on... but the best of all is the professional staff. Enjoyed alson the health centre services - absolutely relaxing. Greates thanks to Caroline ( quest relationship) and Carolline M ( restaurant). Wish to be back soon :)
title: Incredible value in a heavenly locale

review: We did our best to make due with the smaller luxury "tent" which, while it originally seemed wonderful...we found it cramped for luggage space and bathroom use especially after seeing the "deluxe tent"   Definitely go for the larger tent.  The extra space is worth it!  The service, staff  and food were excellent.  We enjoyed the fire pit in the bar and the music.  The grounds are beautiful.
title: Unexpected luxury in the African bush

review: Not really sure what this place would be like as it was booked through a group trip, we took the "deluxe tent" option. Pleasantly surprised by the size of the "tent", it had a luxurious bed covered with mosquito netting, an enormous bathroom and plenty of room for bags. The staff were cheery and helpful and the buffet had many choices. We had a pleasant massage one afternoon when we had a rare moment of free time from the conference we were attending around game drives. One of our group had to see the doctor and was very complimentary about his level of care. The pool area seemed nice although we didn't use this. We did use the business room for internet. The small shop had a number of favourable priced local African souvenirs. The proximity to the game reserve was great. We
title: Fantastic experience!!!
Relive The Lion King at Masaimara

review: Wonderful camp, lovely tents very comfortable. We considered ourselves to have had the best guide in Anthony who found all the game we wanted to see and much much more. Other staff of note are Simon in the bar, Rhoda in the restaurant and John our attendant all made our Stay memorable.  We had breakfast twice watching game on the Mara, organised by Anthony, this is something you need to do.   One very small point, please get some sharper knives to cut the lovely meet you cook.  Rob and Linda
title: The people make this place

review: This game reserve is great with lots of animals, the food is good quality with a  very good choice, the staff are great and very friendly and polite , rooms are terrific, it would be hard to find better , A* for all

Excellent place, unfortunately we had just two days for Masai Mara so our stay in Sarova Mara was just one night. Staff was extremely friendly and hopeful. Masai warriors dance was just nice. Mosquito replant was provided in the tent, very useful.
title: One night in Sarova Mara

review: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights, as a part of our first safari in Kenya. I really liked the hotel, our tent was well equiped, with a fully functioning bathroom, a spacious double bed and a terrace. The location of the hotel is great as well, as it's inside of the park and you get get to the animals fairly quick. You find everything you need on the premises, including a restaurant, a swimmingpool and a bar. Wifi is available, but they do charge you for it. Really enjoyed our stay!
title: By far the best tent I ever slept in

review: Very comfortable tent but with fully equipped shower, toilet and handbasin. Was in a great location. In the mara so animals appeared almost the minute you exited the gates.  We were informed it was all inclusive but this did not include soft drinks or alcohol so make sure you have provisions to pay for these.There was always a large choice to food available as it was buffet service and meal times were very convenient.  Word of advice - take some small change with you as everyone expects a tip.   Trip booked through http://www.explorerkenya.com/ who were fab and we would definitely recommend.
title: Great time

review: Sarova Mara gives you the ultimate experience of the African safari. Was very fortunate to have Edward as our guide, was very enterprising and enthusiastic to ensure that our needs were met. Gave us right guidance and was never pushy. Was very experienced and you could see the other guides too seeking his assistance.  Sarovas tented accommodation was well equipped. The food was above average. Advice - check your package to ensure that all that you have signed up for is provided to you. Advice on clothing - wear what ever you are comfortable in, carry a hat, early mornings and evenings are cool, so you need a jacket. Don't worry about colours as you are in a vehicle and it does not matter at all.
title: African Safari

review: We stayed for two nights in August with our 9-year old son, and same as with the Lionhill Sarova Lodge, we were pleasantly surprised. The common areas are very charming, the staff is very friendly and accommodating and the food variety and quality is good. I only missed more fruit variety... The waitress at the restaurant was nice enough to save the same table in the terrace during every meal for us, a nice touch. I was expecting wifi to be free as in the other Sarova lodge in Lake Nakuru, but I guess being in the middle of nowhere makes it a small luxury!
title: Great experience!

review: This game camp was a fitting way to spend our last night of a 21 day safari. We stayed in the Club Tents. They are beautifully appointed in woodlands around the property. The service was excellent and the array of foods both African and Western plentiful and of a very high standard. Sarova Mara Game Camp is well positioned . The rolling plains around the Camp are teeming with wildebeest, gazelles and zebras during the migration months, and the Camp is situated right in the center of their migration path.
title: Wonderful way to finish a safari

review: Ok .. i ve wanted to visit Africa for as long as I can remember. I am African American and Africa holds a special place in my heart.  The Sarova Mara Game Camp surpasses my dream. Rhonda, Lucy, Steven, Simon, Raphael are just a joy. (as well as others I cant remember their names).  The service here is top notch. My husband and I were "gifted " with a champagne breakfast  out on the grounds this morning as a " surprise"!  Additionally, our "tent" ( which is the most luxurious tent i've ever stayed in) was upgraded to a "tent" that really should be called a cottage... ceiling fan, hardwood floors, tiled bathroom, double sinks, queen sized bed, veranda. The staff is genuinely warm and generous.!! The food is excellent!  The grounds are beautiful! The attention to every detail is
title: Incredible! A dream come true... really!

review: We were greeted by friendly staff and the happy, friendly, efficient, yet informal atmosphere permeated throughout, which made it evident that all staff are all well-trained and enjoy their work.  Nothing was too much trouble for them.  The front-of-house lady in the restaurant (manager?) was charming and a real treasure.  Our family tent no. 5/6 was luxurious (the word "tent" is misleading) with two lovely bedrooms, bathrooms and showers, linked by a large sitting area.  The beds were unbelievably comfortable, with nets and (yes!) hot water bottles!  Torches were provided for the cut-out of the generator in the middle of the night but we were too exhausted from our safaris to need them.  There was everything we could need and an atmosphere which exceeded any plush hotel.  Plus
title: We were made so welcome

review: The staff was ready for us ,we arrived late afternoon had late lunch which was excellent-they have an organic garden.Very healthy tasty meals including breakfast.After dinner the tents are cold and to my very pleasant surprise -Hot Water Bottle in my bed!!! Late afternoon from 4p,game drive and had our first pride lions!!!Our driver from Bunson Travel had great.
title: Wonderful Stay

review: Spent 2 nights at this luxury tented camp. Food was excellent, game runs were fantastic - our Guide Ken and Anthony went out of their way - in the first 2 hours we saw 3 Leopards, elephants, Lions. By the time we had done 3 runs we saw all the animals of the Mara. Next trip will have to be for the Migration.
title: Enjoyed our new year's at the sarova mara

review: Anyone going to the Masai Mara is making an excellent choice for a holiday destination. Staying at the Sarova Mara made our holiday even that much better. We enjoyed the food,the outdoor  activities especially the game drives. Our guide Denis from Sarova hotel had quite the hunter's eye and with him  both as a driver and guide we saw numerous animals including the big five. He was also very knowledgeable about the different animals.  Our dining experience was also worth noting, we were serenaded by music from the one man guitarist Wario whose  soothing voice and sing along tunes was all we needed for a perfect experience.
title: Surpassed Expectations

review: Our stay at the Sarova Mara Game Camp was the highlight of our 10 day Kenya and Tanzania safari. We stayed for two nights, but wish we could have stayed longer. We were greeted by a Masai gentleman in full regalia. We stayed in the club tents which were absolutely beautiful. There was a large queen-sized bed and a cot for a child. The bathroom was amazing! Our tent was at the very edge of the property so we were a little scared the first night, but quickly became used to the sounds of the tree branches hitting the roof. The fairy-like dikdik deer outside our tent just added to the ambiance! We loved the furnishings, especially the canvas shelves. There was a large variety of food at every meal. We enjoyed the different stations where they cooked the meat and fish on request. The
title: Sarova Mara Game Camp
Very nice camp lodge in Masai Mara

review: This was a great location inside the park, a large property with very nice service, lovely people and very nice rooms.  The food was nice, but not what I would describe as outstanding.  I would highly recommend getting a club tent, although be aware you might have a good 5 minute walk to the main reception and restaurant area.  I didn't like the fact that the rooms could not be locked except when you were in it, but there was a safe for valuables.
title: Great Location

review: We stayed at Sarova Mara Game Camp for two nights in early July.  It was a good place to stay. The location was fantastic - right in the middle of the park (this alone is a reason to stay there); the staff were very friendly; the pool and amenities were good.  The food was of variable quality - one night (an Indian night) was sensational.  The following night the food was ordinary.  Permanent tents were the sleeping accommodation and they were very comfortable, the only thing to note is that it can be a long walk from the tent to the main facilities - so if you forget something in the tent (glasses, camera etc) it can be a bit of a pain.  Overall I'd recommend it as a place to spend a night or two.
title: Like Luxury Camping

review: Our group stayed here on our last two nights in Kenya.  We arrived to cold towels and a staff with a great sense of humor.  The tents are made of thick material and seemed to do a good job of keeping the bugs out.  At night you can hear wildlife all around you, and I even almost stepped on a dikdik while making my way back to my tent.  The tents are well furnished with a large bed, but I will just note that you have to duck a little while making your way to the back of the room.  The food was buffet style and consistent (if not a tiny bit better) than some of the other lodges.  The entertainment (Masai Mara village dancing) was quite a bit of fun and the bar featured a nice warm fireplace and plenty of comfortable seating.  I really enjoyed my stay!
title: 4 Star Camp

review: where to start. My family and I decided to do something different this christmas and thats how we found ourselves at the Mara. It has been a rainy month so we were a bit hesitant as we were going by road and all the horror stories we have heard of people getting stuck on the road for hours didnt help much. On 23rd dec we left for sarova mara from nairobi not knowing what to expect. The journey is on a smooth road till past Narok town to a place called mwisho wa lami or something like that and then it get bumpy for almost 1hr and a half as we get to the Mara reserve and to the hotel. If you can hire a 4x4 land cruiser as they literally cruise on that road which was quite funny as on the highway everyone was overtaking us but on the bumpy road we overtook everyone. Once you get to
title: AMAZING
Perfect, the only but is location, too far from the river

review: The lodge is perfect, the tents so nice and comfortable. The only inconvenience is the location, it takes far too long to go to the river, not so easy to see the migration if you are not lucky enough to see it the first time. Highly recommended the sundowner, if possible don't miss it, it was much better than expected.
title: Sarova Mara Game Camp, Kenya

review: If you want a luxury tented experience, this is a great resort.  The rooms are beautiful and have several categories of rooms.  Even family suites to accommodate everyone. Each tent had a patio or balcony, mini bar in room, & good food.  The staff was exceptionable. It is a beautiful property very close to safari's & Maasai Mara Village.  This is a must to see.
title: Fantastic, personalised safari adventure!

review: Every aspect of our holiday with Sarova Mara Game Camp was perfect, from the wildlife to the staff attitude, the cleanliness to the knowledge of our guide.  We would highly recommend to anyone looking for an unforgettable safari.
title: Exceptional stay in the 'wild'

review: We had the pleasure of staying here in July 2013. Upon arrival at the airstrip, we were picked up by our assigned game guide/driver Daniel who was a was a local maasai who was very polite, friendly, professional and professional. He helped us find and see 4 of the big five - buffalo, elephant, lion and rhino, but up till the last game drive, we had not seen a leopard, but through his persistence and knowledge, we were able to see not 1 leopard, but 3 of them, just feet in front of us and just 30 mins before we had to head back to the lodge to pick up our bags and fly back to Nairobi. A big plus for this camp is that your assigned guide remains with you for the duration of your stay, so he is always aware of your particular preferences and what has not been seen.  The level of
title: Comfort and service in the bush

review: On my recent trip back to Kenya, I stayed twice at Sarova Mara. I just love the staff there. They treat me like absolute royalty and it becomes harder to leave each time I stay. ( I've lost count how many times I've been there.) Everything about the place is just gorgeous and it has become my home away from home and the staff are my "African family ". Nothing is too much trouble. I always love my "tent " ..the privacy , quietness and outlook. And to lie in bed at night and hear the animals over the fence is awesome. My room is always maintained to a high standard.  A stay in Kenya for me would not be complete without staying at Sarova Mara. I am already in planning mode for 2014 and totally looking forward to it.
title: Unexpected luxury

review: The dirt roads leading to the lodge are rough but the pampering begins as soon as you arrive. Beautiful lobby area, outdoor pool, good restaurant and bar (not that you have any choice) and the deluxe tents are spectacular. The tents have polished wood floors and roof with canvass sides that the room staff roll up and down each day. Large dressing areas and huge bathrooms, all with stone countertops, were a treat. Very comfortable! Some of the tents are a good walk away from the main public areas, so ask how long a walk it will be. Hint: Go to the overlook at dusk to sip a drink and watch animals wander through.
title: Home Again !

review: Our 7th visit felt like returning to paradise. As usual we were met at the airstrip by the ever smiling Ken driver /guide with cold glasses of fresh juice and cold face towels. At the lodge were welcomed by Francis G.M.and his competent team.A well placed Lodge in the nature reserve with clean rooms.From out tent we see zebras grazing .In the 5 days we saw the crossing ,the BIG FIVE and lions with cubs feeding on an Eland. The bush breakfast and lunch was well prepared and packed.The cooler was always stocked. A big Asante to Head Bartender Mohamed Bartender Daglous Waitress Esther Hostess Lucy F.B> Manager Mike  and to all staff for their ever smiling services.Last but not least Grace for a great massage. Once again well done Sarova Team.Keep it up !! We will be BACK !
title: Out of this World

review: We stopped here for the last two nights of our 'Best of Kenya' safari through Thomson's. My  only deep regret is that we didn't stay for much longer!  My husband was due to celebrate his birthday whilst at the lodge and for a special treat, we upgraded to a club tent.. My special thanks to both Stephen and Emmanuel for making this happen.  I would have in hesitation in recommending an upgrade, the tent was just magical with a huge four poster bed, covered veranda, separate dressing room and fabulous bathroom.  All the creature comforts including mini bar, slippers dressing gowns etc etc.. We stayed in tent no 71 which was at the back of the complex overlooking the African bush, we had Dik Dik and Hyrax as neighbours and the sound of a frog corus to send us off to sleep!   The
title: Simply the best!

review: Had a free upgrade for our honeymoon to a club tent on the edge of the reserve, which was wonderful.  Large tent, dressing room, huge bathroom and roof over to protect us from the elements!  Mosi nets and plug ins provided and turned on etc by the staff so felt quite bug safe.  Had 4 tree hyraxes living above us, which were very cute and dik diks wandering around our garden!  Great staff.  Food good and a good choice.  Bar in the evenings had a huge fire roaring (although it was still warm!)  Welcomed us back from first game drive with a champagne breakfast on the lawn!  Pool nice, but cold.  Game drives from here  were excellent, saw the big five close up, even becoming complacent to the animals.  Electric goes off each night and afternoon during game drives to preserve. Which
title: Sarova Mara Game Park

review: This place is wonderful.  The staff are the best, the food amazing. We loved our tent accomodation... "really glamping" Our Safari drivers Edward was very informative and willing to search hard for those hard to find animals. We saw a lepard 20 minutes into our first safari! We will be back!!!
title: awesome place & a wedding to remember

review: We stayed 3 nights here as part of a safari tour.  Our tent overlooked the small pond, and sitting on our deck with wine, amazed at being in Africa, was very special.  The service was excellent. Upon finding our tent had a king-size bed, plus a twin bed, for just the two of us, we asked that the smaller bed be removed, and that was accomplished very quickly.  When we returned from dinner the first night, the tent flaps had been raised, mosquito netting in place, soft lights on - very romantic!  Food was fine and plentiful and it was interesting to see the organic garden where some of the herbs and produce are grown.  It was a great beginning to our safari experience.
title: Just like being in the movies!

review: I am not sure you can really define them "tents" although they are technically tents. They are decorated with taste, they are spacious, with wooden floor, big and very comfortable beds and nice bathrooms. The staff keeps them clean and offers you any additional service to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. A very luxurious camping experience I would say.   The camp has a swimming pool, a pond, a few observation points on areas where the animal gather to drink, and sometimes you see dik dik and other antelopes hanging around the tents. During the night, you can hear sounds that make you really feel in Africa.   The restaurant area is nice and the service there is quick, efficient and attentive. The food is ok and there is variety.   Overall, an amazing stay!
title: A camping experience within Masai Mara without any of the issues of camping

review: i am quite late in giving a review of the hotel. but the memory of our stay in this hotel still lingers in our minds. My wife was so impressed with this hotel way more than any other hotel we have been. the reception was very friendly and answers queries truthfully. we dont see that everyday. the food was good but the attention you get from the people there is just too good. chef Gilbert was the highlight for us. we stayed there for 6 nights and we had one of the club tents. thanks to their service of guiding us to our tents in the night, just gives u that extra comfort at night.  they arranged for a breakfast in the garden for us which just put the cherry on the top. this is one of the best hotels we have been to and would definitely go back there in our next trip to Kenya.
title: One of the best places one can stay

review: We travelled here as a couple on a tour and found it quite relaxed. There is not much walking to be done internally. The Club Tents looked much nicer to us, although we had a standard one. We were a fair way away in the 50's in terms of tent numbers. It's not the real tent experience as there is an electric fence around the compound. I think it was a good introduction to the Masai, and we were well looked after. The staff were initially a bit reserved, but very friendly.  A birthday celebration for one of our party was memorable for its enthusiasm and the African take on a birthday song.  Wine list not the greatest, but we certainly were well fed. Indian food and bread was an unexpected highlight.
title: Four Nights as a base for the Migration

review: This was the largest Safari Lodge we stayed in during our week-long safari. The tents were a bit too small, but had a nice layout and lovely turn-down service that zipped up the tent and set up the mosquito netting. The restaurant was amazing in all the offerings it had. Beautiful desserts, cook-to-order pasta and big buffet with Kenyan and Indian food. Lots of fresh salads and vegetables were always plentiful.  The pool was small, but never had time to use it anyway. The grounds were beautiful and the check-in process was easy and thorough. Good wi-fi, great gift shop, friendly bar service with a great camp fire in the center of it. Just beautiful and its only minutes from the great animals in the Reserve. Great Place!
title: Great place in the Masai Mara!

review: The tents are nice. Food OK! Hotels expensive and don't see why! Safari $70 per person, u need to also pay the park $70 p/p per night. Hotel is full board, around 700 per night for 2. Not including the above fees. If u go, arrange safari from somewhere else, much cheaper!
title: Hidden Fees

review: we have just returned from a trip to the Masai Mara and our stay in this hotel was brilliant. The staff were so lovely, especially with our 7 year old, the accommodation is  great and its ideally placed to go out on the safari drives. We will definitely be returning!
title: fantastic!

review: Stayed here for the first safari of my first trip to Africa.  Could not have asked for a better introduction.  Our guide in the park, Peter, was wonderful.   Happy and informative, he made sure we saw all we could and accommodated our various requests - wait, lets go back and find those giraffes again.  Clearly very experienced and able to find us the best vantage point for pictures, I can't imagine a better guide.   The staff at the Sarova were all friendly and accommodating, we had excellent service at the restaurant, bar, pool and reception/check out.  The tents - clean and well equipped were nicer than many hotels. The trip was pricey, but then, it was a once in a lifetime experience.
title: Fantastic introduction to Masai Mara

review: We drove from Nairobi to Mara. The road was very good all the way past Narok, but then it was very bumpy and dusty. We dropped the Masai visit and got an extra game-drive before check-in at the hotel.   Very friendly staff and effective check-in. Beautiful tents with lovely beds (firm). The dik dik's and bush-buck's wander around the tent so just sit quiet so you don't scare them.  Food is excellent and the staff very attentive. We got to try the pool too - very refreshing! And the massage was wonderful after a long day of driving.  The camp is far from the river, but we saw a lot of animals and the migration was over before we arrived. First view was a leopard in a tree!   The decorations around the hotelarea are very creative and the gift shop is absolutely worth a visit. The
title: Great choice in Mara!

review: Our family of 2 adults an 2 kids aged 5 and 3 stayed at the mara sarova for 5 nights in may 2013..  Beautiful property, nice tents with hot packs tucked into our beds at night, greatbuffets with western, indian and local food, which we thoroughly enjoyed...  The staff were so friendly and ready to please the guests...One of the ladies at the restaurant even did my daughter's hair, african style plaits...a superb experience of .african hospitality ... We had game drives twice a day...the lodge is well located... In fact lions can be spotted a couple of kms away from the lodge... A child friendly place
title: Fantastic Mara experience
